CowB9a7lElX8Kz2eJzIkuA.text: It's been 2 weeks since we ate here. I have thought about our meal every day since. Not only is this place the best Italin restaurant in the West Valley. It is one the best restaurants in Arizona. The food is the real deal. The ragu over parpadella is the best I have ever had. The homemade  ravioli is also the best I have had. It is family owned and operated. The pride and passion shows in everything they do.  Fabio thank you for doing what you do!!

GzNzbPshIoDUh8fghU2RAA.text: Looking for a great Italian food experience? This is the place! A small and intimate restaurant which caters to delightful aromas and delicious food from the bread served at seating to the wood fired pizza, fresh pasta menu, specials, and the use of decadent rich sauces. Listening to the service staff chat in Italian as they take care of thier guest adds a subtle comfort to the experience. The attention FIORELLA gives her guests far outpaces an already excellent staff and wraps the dining experience into a meal where the diner is treated like family and not a customer. Arrive early and enjoy the sights, sounds, and overwhelming aromas only good Italian food can create, and have Fiorella guide you through a great meal.

maRJQ4dykyGISsF0-KGmTA.text: Went for the first time and was so happy to find this gem. Husband and wife owned and operated and food was fantastic. Going back two days in a row in fact. So good.

dbcQ5bNn8mUtuawqn00NjA.text: High quality Italian restaurant. Impeccable service. Call ahead for same day reservation. Ask for Raphael to serve you. He is great! We eat here every time we go to Phoenix.

9ddradK2CmIJ5_C-LGxJhw.text: This is the best place to go if you want really authentic Italian food. I haven't ordered anything that I didn't fall in love with. Everyone that works there as well makes you feel like you're having dinner order lunch with your family. Fabio always comes and greets us, as well as gives us a hug on our way out.  I would have to say it's the best Italian food in Peoria. Great selection of wines, red white and sparkling. Charcuterie board is amazing. Don't have anything bad to say about this place.

ePVjRevaTF4QgatKojHnLw.text: Over rated. The lasagna was slapped together with very thick layers of chunky hamburger meat with sauce then the cheese then the pasta and then repeated. I literally felt ill from it. Absolutely nothing special about it. Waitress was hard to get a hold of. Fabulous selection of cookies.  Never returned.

Kn_4qBCA5txv4IsQ9f3nJw.text: Excellent food.! Trully authentic italian flavors. Great customer service. Def coming back again!

G4qtPh5mDoxxZplqMy5L9A.text: This was our second time here. We went on a Friday night, which was our first mistake. The waiter seemed rushed and forgot to tell us about all the specials. My wife ordered the fettuccine with lobster. She asked what kind of sauce it came in and was told a scampi sauce. It came in a cream sauce. She asked if it came with chunks of lobster, I saw one chunk and little pieces. For a pricey $40, it should of had chunks. We complained and after waiting awhile the waiter told us the owner was coming out. The sous chef came out Christopher who apologized and offered to make another one or since I was already finished, we had him take it off the check. He was very accommodating. Just wish the waiter knew his specials and how the food was prepared. In a review that I was emailed, I stated how disappointed we were with the waiter and meal, only to get a mean response from the manager calling us a liar and telling us we were video taped and could tell how much lobster was in my wife's meal. In addition we were told not to come back. That wasn't a problem, because I told my wife after the meal that was it for Fabio, we wouldn't be coming back. What an attitude by this manager!! On to other and better Italian restaurants!!

_GYF5__hMDKjIC-OW0d0yQ.text: A perfect little Italian restaurant in the West Valley.  This is our second experience here and the dinner was excellent.  Very friendly family run business.  My wife had pear salad with butternut squash ravioli, Dad and girlfriend shared a salad with rack of lamb.  I had prosciutto/burrata appetizer with an excellent pizza. A very rich  Napolean for desert, four spoons. Excellent presentation, casual atmosphere, loads of fun.  Highly recommend.

IDRt4wdybMUQH6vrMIK4pQ.text: Amazing atmosphere, delicious food,wonderful server and owner. I will be back soon!! I enjoyed all aspects of my evening.

XyWoOfV1OomZUbS19iNSrg.text: Food was way overpriced for what you got.  Cioppino was basically seafood pasta with very little seafood.   Lamb entree was boring and tasteless.  Service was good.

jJMUg6W-9hZhqD9DGlEpeA.text: Average post for average food and service don't know to say was expecting to be I owed but really wasn't

8wcUhBBSXgbEeZS1OFNiyg.text: First and last time for this restaurant. Very small, I felt I was in a tin can. Owner and his wife went on chatting with customers for excessive amount of time while my wife and I waited patiently for service. Other employees looked at us like we weren't even there. People stood around ignoring us. After much patience we got up and walked out. Several employees looked at us but nobody asked if anything was wrong or thanked us for our business.  DONE!!!!!!!!! Couldn't even comment on the quality of the food, because we never had a chance to try it.

GH6KmsOXju9YOxVSacg2bQ.text: Summary: Great Italian food, very friendly staff. Go here and eat. Not many tables, so go early.  Referred: By a friend.  Waiter: Raphael. Treated us like family. Seemed genuinely glad that we were there, eating at (his?) restaurant. Super neat guy.  Wait: We were seated immediately and were served some bread while we waited. They promptly took or order, which took a little while to be prepared. However, the food was made to order, and we were not disappointed by the wait. (This is NOT Olive Garden speed.)  While we waited: Delicious handmade bread w/ oil and vinegar. We ate a bunch of this stuff, then bought a loaf to eat at home. They were not stingy with the bread, which was nice.  - - -  Dishes:  Butternut Squash Ravioli. Me. Rich, handmade pasta, creamy sauce. Not a giant portion, but very rich and delicious... the squash was sweet against the cheesy cream sauce. (You probably wouldn't want a giant bowl of this.) I'd eat this again.  Margarita Pizza. 15 year old son. Great crust, handmade sauce. Good stuff. Son enjoyed it. (I stole a piece.)  Bolognese. Wife. Tasty as well. Rich meat sauce. Nicely made pasta. Me and my wife shared this and my Ravioli, which paired together nicely. (I'd share like this again.)  - - -  Overall, we felt like family, had a great meal, and would go back here again. You should too, but get there early as it's not a large place.  Glad to have a place like this in Peoria.

i7k52cSCr2sZnxUp0fhOLA.text: I don't understand the hype about this place. Is it because the owner is there greeting everyone with an Italian accent to give an authentic feel? My wife and I went to Fabio on fire because we heard nothing but good things about the restaurant. So we stopped by and the place was a almost empty. The host quickly shoved us to the bar stating they didn't have any tables available. In the meantime I could not get over the fact that the restaurant was almost empty. I waved down who I think owns the place and asked if we could sit at a table and the owner noticed we were annoyed with our seating in which he decided to explain in a very condescending manner on how to make reservations and how I missed out on that opportunity. The night went quickly downhill from there. I just asked a simple question and in return I got an explanation of what I needed to do to get a table there as if it was my first time to a restaurant. I really got annoyed and I'll admit I did give him attitude and told him it's not my first time at a restaurant and to get to the point, which I understand was a bit harsh but that was a result if the owner being condescending towards me. My wife and I just bit the bullet and ordered the food thinking it's worth putting up with the owner because of all the good things we hear about this place. The owner got really awkward with us as if he could not handle the attitude I was giving him, if he was good at his job he would've been able to defuse the situation but he didn't. He kept getting in my wife's face and asking her what we wanted to order and forced us to listen to the specials. We all ordered pasta with the same meat sauce, pure laziness because all the dishes pretty much taste the same with no major changes other than the pasta itself. We had the bolognese meat sauce which paled in comparison to the meat sauce offered at The Parlor in central Phoenix, which blows this place out of the water. The owner again came by and asked my wife if we wanted deserts than looked at me and said with an attitude "sweets" as if I did not know what desserts are. At this point we quickly asked for the check so we can get out of that awkward situation.   TLTR: Don't show the owner you are annoyed because he will serve you a dish of condescending attitude.  Pasta is subpar and not worth the many stars compared to other Italian restaurants.   All I know is I won't give this place a second chance and I hope the owner reads this and realize to not treat customers like they are a child.

e_o-9oRvYowFS4OZ3LTzxQ.text: Food is good service is not good. Waiters are forgetful and mess the order up. Food takes forever. But it's good

QBa72390hW0w7ML1ulM2QQ.text: This place was way better than I imagined. The food was amazing and so was the service. It was busy but the service was quick and the server was attentive. I had the butternut squash ravioli and I was a bit nervous to try something new and unlike anything I would normally order and I was so pleasantly surprised. We didn't feel rushed like we would at other busy restaurants on Friday night even though it was busy. It was not just great food but a great experience. We will definitely be back!!

3iL4Gm_owksO9LSuZdYQOQ.text: This was my first time dining in the restaurant, the service was great, food are very delicious and seems very authentic (I have never been to Italy before) We ordered lasagna and butternut squash ravioli with prosciutto.  The lasagna was very good, different than the usually kind we have, have more juicy meat pieces than tomato sauce, but it was just enough, and very good, it has less cheese between the layers than we expected, but it was perfect, Maybe that's how authentic lasagna should be? I don't know. We added some crushed red peppers on top too, which makes it taste even better. The butternut squash is very creamy, and tasty, it is the perfect combination with some prosciutto pieces. The portion size is great, it's not too much, and it's not too small, we were attracted by their dessert menu and decided to share a gelato. It was a strawberry flavored gelato. Oh my, that was that best gelato we both have ever tasted. Very fresh and you can taste strawberry in every single spoon. Would definitely come back! Great price too! The gelato only cost $2.95 (if I remember correctly)

xoHUx5zFEErm2DjMdkfnrw.text: Authentic Italian cuisine.  Hidden gem but very small.  Caprese salad just ok but buffalo mozzarella was delicious. I loved my butternut squash ravioli but my husband thought the lasagna was just so-so but he is used to my lasagna packed with meat and cheese.

lU3mwupYcLcZsVzFn53TBg.text: Reheated my tagliatelle that was given to the wrong table. Saw it happen. (Open kitchen) wrong salad given to my wife and was taken to another patron. Mom pushing high prices items . Place is a gimmick. Another valley money grab!

w_Q2OXLC85KtSlQ4hjjMMQ.text: Always a friendly atmosphere and even better food!! We love ordering a bottle of wine and enjoying a nice meal. Don't forget to get a cannoli!

_ipOsQ_osxHqJKoDAVXmfw.text: Super cute little restaurant however for the price the value is not there. 5 ravioli for $20. They were decent but not worth it. The focaccia bread was delish. Won't bother going back again.

LBuPxRVySfhcdxUHTS8B5w.text: This place just opened and it's a gem! Everything is made from scratch.  When you walk in you are greeted with a heavenly aroma! The staff is wonderful and kind.  As we were waiting for a to go order two women and a baby came in and as Fabio chatted with them he bend down and sweetly kissed the baby on the cheek.  It was adorable! The food does not disappoint, it was delicious and tasted like the homemade Italian food I grew up with.  Five stars to Fabio and his staff, excellent job, we can't wait to come back!

G_161WyRdiVdvvWhQdjtZA.text: The food is delicious. So thankful for an authentic, one of a kind restaurant in our area of town. Service was exceptional. The waitress radiates a passion for the food and kindness.

jQFGYZCa6t-KTkxVIwG9cA.text: I don't write many ratings and too often I feel that it is the negative ratings that people prefer to write as opposed to when they have had a good experience. I just left my 3rd visit there with my Wife and daughters and every experience is as good or better than the last.  That being said I had to write this rating... Let's start with the fact that I am Italian. Not "eye-talian" but italyn or for those from Italy, "ee-taliano".  The closer you are to pronouncing it as "eye-talian", the less you will understand the culture, the ambiance, the tempo and pace as well as the ingredients of an authentic Italian restaurant like this. I grew up in an Italian restaurant back in Chicago and spent 10 years working in this environment having performed every job in a restaurant form busboy, to cook to Manager and every job in between. Chicago has so many good Italian restaurants you can't throw a stone in any direction without hitting one. I hope that all that introduction says something when I tell you this place is authentic and excellent. I am not going to write about the excellent foods of which there are many and if you don't understand what authentic Neapolitan pizza is supposed to be like (slightly wet) you won't understand this pizza...  but I am going to tell you to come here with enough time, patience and love of food to appreciate what they are doing. Don't be in a rush, don't expect fast food or Olive Garden service... expect authentic people with love for what they do that treat you like family. That ingredients are of the highest quality mostly flown in from Italy.  Their attention to flavors is as realistic to my family experience as it gets. This is a real Italian restaurant with real Italian quality and attention and love of food. Don't rush this experience. If your glass in empty, take a breath, catch the waiter or waitress on the next pass through (it is a small place and easy to flag down your waiter) and sit and relax. Don't push this experience, Italians enjoy food as a way to spend time and enjoy friends and family not to wolf down food and get out to the next thing on your list. Once you figure out how to experience an Italian meal "Italian style" the quality of your experience will skyrocket as this is the core of the Italian culture.  Thank you Fabio for bringing this unique experience to the West valley.

_ibswwoqt9h6aTraueBQsg.text: Such a great little spot!  Our favorite place to dine and relax.  Fabio hit a home run by bringing all his signature dishes here.  Don't go there in a rush for a meal, this is a sit and relax type of dining experience.

ThZH32oR2wosGNT97Guz6A.text: Long overdue to have a great Italian restaurant on the west side. Everything is home made and was amazing. I had the lasagna which was amazing, and my wife had the butternut squash ravioli. Everything was amazing, can't wait to go back!

MvZ9w_HwFgxQYJulAGh35w.text: My wife and I ate at Fabio on Fire last weekend. It was recommended to us by someone at Blackstone Country Club. We got there early and were immediately seated, our drink order taken, and bread and olive oil delivered promptly. The menu is a bit anemic. I asked if they had chicken Parmesan-my favorite Italian meal, and the answer was no. I selected the lasagna. Good size portion, excellent sauce. My wife had the butternut squash- she loved it. I would have given 5 stars if the menu were more extensive. At the conclusion of the meal the restaurant was filling up. We will be back, hoping the menu grows as the popularity increases. A final thought - the bread is made on site and is wonderful. Try it, a good place run by good people. I prefer giving my business to the mom and pop, non chain, places. Their name is on the door and know their survival is the goodness of the meals they create. Fabio on Fire does not disappoint.

u9GgKOZxBJsvkyhIWIGs3g.text: Oh my goodness - Italian good to die for.  Recipes from grandma for sure.   The owner is engaged and follows up with tables.   The servers are personable and quick to get you anything you need.   Very cozy feel.  The food was outstanding.   They had nine specials not on the menu.   Their gelato was unforgettable - dark chocolate.

DzXfey0wjUUoXz13QXx4Bg.text: First off, food was so delicious. Unbelievably authentic. Italian bread baked in house. Owner is straight off the boat. The service was top notch. Highly recommend.

PHzFtJ99zGUnR1fGswb-8g.text: First time eating here and we will be regulars. The food is fantastic and as homemade Italian as you will get. The Butternut Squash Raviolis are tender with a hint of smokey prosciutto but the squash is amazingly sweet. The seafood spaghetti loaded with mussels and shrimp. Mussels were fresh and shrimp were tender. Red sauce was amazing on top of the fresh spaghetti noodles and nice change from the typical white wine sauce. Wood fired pizza which we didn't have this time but my wife had it her last visit and also amazing. Small seating but gives you that family style feel. Must say hello to Franco. Very passionate about serving you the best Italian in Peoria!

lOa1qY9g0f30CtoqoPpmAw.text: In the merry go round of food trucks, something that isn't fried is worth a shot.  This particular truck is worth a couple shots.  You know...for science.   I just had a pretty good pizza. From a *truck*.  Big marble slab for the dough prep, I saw the fire in that oven, counter (table?) staff was very helpful and personable, pizza was taaaasty, crust was puffy...win!

bYLWHjOTF5FSgsmyDfCkQQ.text: We absolutely loved having Fabio on Fire cater our anniversary party. Arranging everything with Jenny was flawless and easy - she was extremely responsive and helpful. The presentation and food at the event itself were perfect - the bruschetta, salads and pizza were so delicious. Everyone loved being able to order exactly what they wanted and we loved having someone else do all the work so we could enjoy ourselves. Fabio is personable and easy to work with. I can't recommend Fabio on Fire highly enough.

8FiobSpSBw4PGMvAV4mVbA.text: Outstanding new original Italian restaurant with True Italian dishes that are old family recipes. Great selections, great attentive servers and outstanding deserts. Brick pizza oven, great pizza. Highly recommend. The restaurant is small and the waits can be long but the food is worth the wait. Fabio the owner is always on site and speaks to all the customers. Thank you for coming to Peoria.

B0rHagJnftd70hkUFn10mw.text: Great atmosphere, very friendly and everything was home made authentic Italian food. Great wine and the best Cannoli's in town.

t9ga8YALihRMm7JgHcSO0w.text: Impeccable service and deliciously prepared Italian meals.  This is a unique neighborhood gem worth returning or even driving across town.  We found it completely on a whim by looking at nearby restaurants as we left an event at our kids' school.  We were greeted by Fabio who took a moment to meet our family before we were seated.  Our waiter Rafael was charming and a lot of fun.  We really felt like we were family.   We had a delicious bottle of Italian wine at a reasonable price.  The burrata was the amazing (imported from Naples).  Our kids loved the wood fired cheese pizzas.  My wife had the braised short rib ravioli which was so good she wanted a second plate for dessert.  I enjoyed pasta marinara with mussels and shrimp which was among the best I have ever enjoyed in my travels. The Napoleon pastry and strawberry gelato were the proverbial icing on the cake.  Fresh food served by amazing people at a reasonable price.  Fabio even walked us out to thank us for visiting.  We will definitely return.  Highly recommended.

kxn7J7amNJyP-mkx-sG9LQ.text: This restaurant is absolutely amazing! We tried ravioli, a different type of pasta, pizza, and a seafood appetizer. Everything was so delicious! The service was amazing and the environment and vibe makes it feel as though you are in Italy! We will definitely be coming here at least once a month. The desserts are also delicious!

FrOaAklIAXfDNiAjSE4ijA.text: We got takeout. The food is outstanding. Lasagna and bolognese. We'll return again soon.

FyRH0qKg3FWoTTBKZ5l-oQ.text: First time going here, saw it in the AZ Republic! It's been open for 2 months and already packed! 10/10 would recommend. Very small place but the servers were all so nice and helpful as well as attentive. The food was so delicious. Bread given as a starter was so good and sliced meats and cheeses were very fresh. Pizza was very nice and good size for 2 people. Lobster ravioli was a weekend special. Desserts were presented in a glass case all prepared that same day! Cannoli's and Diplomatic Cake were extremely authentic. One of the best and most authentic Italian restaurants I've been to!

-8fRVDDycJUmOZycIrxqWA.text: My husband and I have been dying to try Fabio's since we discovered it a few weeks ago. We went there on a Saturday around 2:30 and there was already a wait. When we checked in with the hostess, she was super nice and gave us menus to look at while we were waiting for our table. Before we were seated, Fabio (the owner) came over and introduced himself and thanked us for coming in. Now on to the food. We started with the Burrata and it was so light and refreshing. For entrees, we ordered the 4 cheese gnocchi and the Tarantina pizza. Gnocchi was light and fluffy and the pizza was probably the best in the valley. Very light and chewy, perfectly cooked. Tiramisu and cannolis for dessert and I hate to repeat myself, but the tiramisu was by far the best I've had. Cannot wait to go back.

xboy6T6AruzThHv0BgIDpg.text: I'm blown away. I just moved to this side of town and was lamenting the lack of stellar restaurant options when I found this gem on Yelp. You could so easily drive past this place nestled in this little strip mall and miss out on an amazing experience.  Don't.  This is a DO NOT MISS. When you walk in, you're greeted immediately, and if you've put your name on the wait list, probably seated right away. Our server listed the verbal specials and then gave us a moment to get familiar with the menu and soak in the atmosphere. It reminded me of so many little restaurants I visited in Italy. We started with the roast pork belly special with hummus and a pear salad. Grabbed an excellent glass of Montepulciano d'Abruzzo and some enormous veal and beef tortelloni in an amazing fresh tomato sauce and a seafood spaghetti with shrimp and mussels in a slightly spicy version of that amazing tomato sauce.  Then we followed up with a sampler box of the amazing cookies and a scoop of peach gelato. The peach gelato was like a creamy, frozen fresh summer peach.   Now, this is very authentic service. Don't expect your server to live next to your table, but they will check up on you and keep your water full and take great care of you.   Go. Go. GO. GO!

rajE3Cdc6NfZHI1jq67ujQ.text: Oh my god oh my god oh my god this place is outstanding. I had a sandwich for lunch and the bread is the pizza dough. Charged slightly made sooooo perfect. If I could give this place more stars I would.   The butternut squash and gnocchi were amazing. Someone in our party had the gluten free pizza and you could tell it was house made dough, not the pre-bought doughs other places have. Delicious! This is a must visit.

r4HVBvhbjDThLnfvciazVA.text: They are trying hard and seem to be making progress  Loved the bruschetta! Nice wine.   Very nice pizza. Service great.   But the chipino was big disappointment I would call it a seafood pasta.   Not a lot of seafood and very lightly if any sauce for like $36 I think it was.   Very high for what it was.  Tiramiso was wonderful !    Going back for sure but probably for the things we loved.

vnveAhSp1kAO3Eo6j95-dw.text: Look no further...this is the best italian style pizza in the Valley. From the moment we entered the restaurant we were greated promptly and sincerely. Sitting at the counter, we enjoyed the action of the pizza maker. Our pizza came out hot and delicious. The crust was excellent. If you are looking for very good italian cuisine with an engaging and fun staff, this is the restaurant for you...

rA1vnJqGIpdEiauq17_Bfg.text: This place was kinda a letdown  me and my wife were looking for a good Italian restaurant so of course we checked yelp for the best one which Fabio on fire seemed to be according to the reviews. When we showed up all the staff seemed to be very friendly. But once we were seated it took about 10min for are waiter to finally greet us and take are drink order. Then about 7min later came back and took our food order. I got traditional lasagna and my wife got a seafood ravioli. Both of our dishes were just ok, not the worst but definitely not the best, especially factoring in the price. which  was about $20-$30 a plate type a place. We both left a little disappointed

C_uLu2KVeHuyvDlp7TKflA.text: Very delicious pasta dishes! The butternut squash ravioli and the gnocchi with 4-cheese sauce were amazing. The only thing that kept me from giving a 5 star rating was because the pasta dishes, although terrific on their own, were kind of sparse for the price. Some sauteed vegetables or a nice salad to go with them would definitely make the meals more filling and worth the $.  The owners were very sweet and attentive. Great personalities and a pleasure to be around.

zKZUPvG2JUbbjw9roh8NcA.text: We wanted to try something new, today. Thanks to the "yelpers" for this recommendation. Our waitress (Fioria?) was very friendly, and explained the menu choices. I ordered the butternut ravioli, and my husband ordered the short rib ravioli. Both were delicious,  and made from scratch. We also had a pistachio cannoli, and an Italian version of a Napolian.  This is my new favorite restaurant! We also took a dozen Italian cookies home. We will be back.

1WmknPSxTkEH_R5Cvg_Inw.text: I had heard from a neighbor that this was a great place to eat. I recommended to two of my friends that we try them for lunch.  Our service was terrible!!! They didn't get our order right and never asked to refill our drinks or even if we needed anything. The caprese' salad hardly had any tomatoes or basil and very little balsamic reduction. Two of us had the margherita pizza which barely had any sauce no tomato slices    tiny pieces of basil, and a few blobs of mozzarella cheese.  Very bland and not good.  The other gal had ravioli which she said wasn't too bad.  She didn't finish and opted not to take the rest home.  It cost $74 for the three of us and no one had alcohol. I did notice another table had salads that looked pretty good.  Made me wish I had ordered something else. I would NOT recommend this place.

Dw91pXjVzgFeZSTJqN3zEA.text: Wow! Just happened upon this place and was blown away.  The mozzarella and prosciutto was the best I've ever had and the butternut ravioli and white sauce was like I died and went to Italian heaven. This place belongs in a better city

1TPKc_aymcLnmA6DS1B-Bw.text: This place is amazing! Service is amazing! I can't say enough great things about it. My kids loved this place too and they are 4 and 8. Husband had lasagna and I had the special which was a sausage and broccoli ravioli that was to die for. Not to mention the tiramisu was the best I've ever had!! Definitely will be back!!

oo0HwEvwObtqNzjISDvP0A.text: I really don't understand the number of 4 and 5 star reviews.  This place is really small, however the decor is impressive.  The hostess was very friendly and attentive to getting us seated.  We only waited about 15 minutes which is really good for a Saturday night around 730pm.  The waiter took about 10 minutes to arrive.  Again not bad considering how busy this place is.  My friend and I ordered the lobster and crab ravioli.  When the dish arrived, I was very surprised with the small portion, especially for a plate with a $25 dollar price tag.  Photo included.  The waiter dropped it off and dissapeared so fast that he didnt see the disappointment in our faces.  I thought it to be customary for the server to ask if you needed anything else before leaving your table.   So, I cut one of the ravioli in half.  I saw a fair amount of cheese inside but no lobster  or crab.  First bite lacked any seafood flavor at all, just cheese and overcooked pasta shell. I tried again with another shell, cheese, no seafood at all.  I tried one final time and again flavorless ravioli that was nothing close to what was described on the menu.  After sitting there in front of this disappointing dish the waiter arrived to see if everything was satisfactory.  I said this was a cheese ravioli that had none of the lobster or crab described on the menu and furthermore the portion was so small it was pathetic.  He asked what I wanted to do.  I said "I don't want this".  He took it away saying he would check with the boss.  He came back stating that he would take it off of our bill but didn't offer to get us something else.  Looking around I noticed most everyone was having pizza.  We paid for our drinks and left.  The positive reviews must be on their pizza.  I don't know if I will return unless we decide to try the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

yRGHe7aFmoPpbQg_WLiFZA.text: Probably the best Italian food outside of Italy. The service is great if it's coming from the owner but the young kids could use a little improvement in customer service.  The ambiance is good but the wait is quite long with no place to sit until your table is ready.  The food is well worth the wait. I will be back again

SxaQ5HVhbyH_wp8bjq6tRg.text: One of the best dinners I have had in the two years I have lived in Phoenix. The bolognese was amazing with plenty for left overs. My kids both got the bambino pizzas and ate every bite. If you are into bottled cokes they have them in several options. My daughter got a sprite and she felt so "fancy". We also got a Napoleon for dessert. I have had my share of Napoleon, but this one was five stars. I wanted to take home a cannoli but stopped myself for fear of eating it at midnight!  I will definitely be back. It's a small cozy restaurant but there was not wait. Love it!

uxuotsen2YfTQJXp5sLQgw.text: We just found the absolute best gem in the west valley of Phoenix. I have never been to a restaurant in Phoenix where the owner engages with you during the entire meal. Rafael was our server and he was fantastic. We had the lobster ravioli and seafood pasta and they were both amazing. Our wine was wonderful. The pistachio gelato was fantastic. Everything is either flown in from Italy or made from scratch in house. Come here. You will not be disappointed. By far, the best experience and food I have ever had in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Our wine for dinner

rO4SHxfLNXvWx6tQR2_ylA.text: This has to be the best Italian food in the valley!  I had no idea that Bruschetta could be that amazing! Emulsion was delicious and the service was great. Rafael was very personable and made us feel like family!

ff0V-_jowvrQP6YjMbq-4A.text: 2/3 meals were good. The lobster ravioli was horrible. Growing up in an Italian household and having been to Italy many, many times- this was a very disappointing meal. The sauce was bland with a bitter after taste and the lobster itself was limited and tasteless. On top of that the costumer service was strange... pointer don't diss your costumers.   Unfortunately will not be returning in fear of paying for overpriced, low quality food.

dGQV2zGPX6Wt2uWCK8Gi3A.text: Hubby and I went out for date night last night.  What a great little find this place was.  We shared the pear salad and the capri... pizza.  Both were delicious!  It's a quaint little place that has a wonderful vibe!  We will be back!!!

d6W6QWlnJJdetJcq70IHIA.text: We used to live in Trilogy at Vistancia and moved to California 2 years ago.  Recently we returned to visit friends and family here in the area and brought our relatives to Fabio's.  We were so pleased with everything from the service to the excellent food and dessert.  We are sorry we missed seeing Fabio since we have followed his career from Tutti Santi days.  Congratulations Fabio.  You have a fabulous ristorante!  Buona fortuna

Xal6PQrJ_7IcznuS1l3VtQ.text: Absolutely delish!! Authentic Italian made with love! Brought home a few pizzas and they were yummy  too! Cute little place!

izjA3TsbVt4xoQJJp38e5w.text: Two girlfriends and I went here the other night and really enjoyed ourselves. The white pizza we ordered was delicious! The pizza with prosciutto was good, and very authentic, but I will say you really need to like prosciutto to enjoy that one. All of us preferred the white pizza. The bread with dipping oil was great, and the caprese appetizer was wonderful! It's a very family oriented place with service that makes you feel like you're a welcome addition. If you like True, authentic Italian food, this is the place for you! But I recommend you call ahead for a reservation, especially if you have a larger group.

GuUnsHyXiwZwhhpvEffwsw.text: Our new favorite Italian restaurant!  It's just like being in Italy. Great food and great service!!

AwFsFqfJuHBteqY4aEGLZw.text: At last there is a quality restaurant in the neighborhood! This small, authentic Italian has homemade pasta and sauces. They use quality ingredients to deliver delicious classic dishes (lasagne, bolonaise, tagliatelle) as well as some innovative pairings (butternut squash ravioli with sage cream- yummy!!). Service was good. Nice wine list too.

GjtOoj523Pv_Tytvwmfxew.text: Fantastic food - I felt like I was back in Italy.  Fabio himself was there talking to us.  Definitely an experience.  We will most certainly return to this wonderful place.

sAbr4awgdMzYxacr5mwuEw.text: I was stunned and blown away on how authentic this Italian restaurant is. The owner and founder named Fabio greeted us at the door behind the bar while making a pizza. The restaurant is very small but has this very warm family vibe. When we chose a place to sit Fabio came over and greeted himself and we shook hands. Everything is home made and only the best ingredients. The smell inside is AH-MAZING! with the wood fired pizza oven! This small family owned Italian Restaurant is a GEM!! I shared the butternut squash ravioli, strawberry salad, and the lasagna. Can't wait to try real authentic pizza next time!

3QILUX6NdrVlIi-L-SuaGg.text: The food was excellent. I was a little disappointed that one person in our party got eggplant parmesan and their plate was full and I got ravioli and my portion was kind of small. I would have at least liked some veggies or something to give me a comparable amount of food for dinner. Nice setting, excellent service. Authentic!

yUeGF8qD8sZam34QUUC6-w.text: Delicious food. The real deal. If you want Italian. Delicious cookies you can take to go as well. Awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

JY4jMqQDakKpuz1ffz4VKA.text: We wanted to order over the phone and go pick it up so I called,  and the guy who answered the phone was not very friendly and said I couldn't order over the phone because they were slammed and I had to come in to order.... the whole point of ordering on the phone is so I don't have to wait for my order when I get there. Not sure how they will last with customer service like this. Very rude first impression

OVMqf2YZZJPwknm4xb5hZg.text: Small but INCREDIBLE food and personable service. Thank goodness for a great high quality restaurant in our area. Butternut squash pasta is a MUST as well as cannoli and espresso.

TpCfKLl5AZ48LQPazbS9uw.text: This place's pizza is just as good or better (in my opinion) as/than Pomo's, Piazza Al Forno, and Pizzeria Bianco's. The little space it is in is not pretentious but a nice local spot. Everyone was very friendly inside (I got a to-go order so I wouldn't have to wait over an hour) and got my food on time. Was quoted 15-20 mins. Also ordered the pesto gnocchi which was not a disappointment. The portions look small but are actually very filling.

vJKPs-8rQm1p59sn51yPSw.text: Phenomenal food and friendly atmosphere. Truly authentic Italian experience. What is lost in a slight lack of organization is more than made up for with excellence in execution with the dishes. Homemade pasta is out of this world! We also had the gelato which was equally impressive. Fabio personally thanked us and checked in. Really nice guy. Just go!!!

K-YbqZ6N3r6Jua1ewTAe3Q.text: We love Fiorella! The bruschetta was good but only two pieces of bread. Expensive! We ordered the butternut squash raviolis. They were excellent except $17 for 5 raviolis is a major rip off! Not sure we will return.

Rk79XVAmkZC0jULvgONoSg.text: All I can say is 'wow!'. I have had Italian all over the country!  Fabio holds his own against Boston's North End and San Francisco's North Beach. Menu was good but when Raphael, our excellent waiter, told us about the specials for the evening I knew we were in for an outstanding meal.  Short rib ravioli was incredible as was the shrimp pesto dish. I had shrimp and mussels in a red sauce, yum!   Fabio came out to the dining room on several  occasions to check on his guests, how awesome is that! Can't wait to go back!

t568G6cVYei_ZeoYCN5p6w.text: Blown away....basically how I feel about this tiny independent restaurant that now has my undivided attention! A friend told me she heard it was really good, so my husband and I decided to give it a shot. There are very few Italian restaurants in Arizona that are really good. Fabio on Fire is REALLY spectacular!!  We got there at 4:30 and were told the wait was about 15-20 minutes. We decided to sit at the counter since there were a couple empty chairs there. Actually a great decision, because we were able to chat with Fabio a bit while he was making pizza. We ordered the Bufalina and it was out of this world! The crust was perfectly charred and crisp yet tender, and the cheese, garlic, arugula and balsamic were fresh and delicious! Next came Lasagna and Lobster ravioli. Again, freshness that you can taste and the pastas are so tender! This is pasta the way it's meant to be! We only ate half of our food so we could try dessert. Classic cannoli and Lemon gelato....oh my!! I finally have a local spot that makes perfect cannoli! My heart is happy!!  Fabio's is officially our go to for great Italian food! A couple pointers-no reservations unless your party is 6 or more and this is a TINY restaurant so be prepared for a wait. But trust me on this one...it is more than worth the wait!!!

zPZJj6Far5hLeL_b80iBxQ.text: By far the best Pizza in the valley. Bianco is good. But not Fabio. The crust is crisp and chewy and the Buffalo Mozzarella is flown in fresh from Naples. My new favorite place for Italian. Keep it up Fabio! It's Fabulous.

CFqQ51a-8QIAMpyWRSU9yw.text: This is the best Italian restaurant I have ever had! Really friendly staff and authentic Italian food!!

vj6dS_ollppHOPfZPx9giQ.text: Do you love Italian food?  I have not had Italian food as good as this since I left New York.  The bread is to die for, the cannolis are exquisite and all of his pastas and pizzas are fantastic.

hIujkWGo9qjGm0UnszyLpg.text: We had the meatball appetizer and veal torteloni today and both were amazing!  The marinara sauce is just like my great grandma used to make. I hope these dishes become regular specials or are added to the menu.  The chocolate chip cannoli was wonderful as well!  We have been waiting for the perfect Italian restaurant for years and we are so glad to now have Fabio on Fire in our area!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Veal Torteloni was amazing!

0Nr6t01xoBGa4ZZSh0yjqg.text: This place is awesome! All their meats are imported from Italy, their bread is handmade, and you can tell! Highly recommend the Bruschetta Moderna, and make sure you get dessert! They also make you feel at home, Antonio and Fabio introduced themselves and made us feel welcome! Definitely coming back again! Soo good.

At83PGgoZT_yxs6UJAN3xw.text: Beyond amazing!!!!!!! The service, food and atmosphere was outstanding. Try this amazing Italian food restaurant!

IKXsMenEDUo5fgc4IBPVBA.text: Everybody likely knows this place for (usually) long wait lists and maybe even a little frustration with that but it more than balances out with the quality of the dining experience!  The space is limited but the ambiance is intimate and inviting, the staff impeccable (shout out to Franco who always seems to get our table -- we love him!) and the food is authentic and DELISH.  A hidden gem in north Peoria. Love this spot!

TCb7FaKJIgfCLd0pM3j31A.text: A delightful little Italian bistro in the neighborhood. Food is delicious and the atmosphere is cozy. My favorite server is Rafael, he remembered me from when Tutti Santi was open at the citadel!

6TNR8E6fWM0dtbHr3U2AEg.text: Very disappointing. Over Priced. Very cramped and small. Kept getting banged into by either patrons or server. Extremely noisy. Will not return.

2E9tk_iWbOFALvBVg9Jx2w.text: My husband and I dined at the bar and had the meatball special for an appetizer and we shared the short rib ravioli special and the capricciosa pizza. The food was amazing and very authentic. The short rib filling was tender and the brown butter sauce was rich and savory. All the staff were very polite and very attentive. It had a very authentic family owned vibe from Italians who love the food they share. I'm very happy that an authentic Italian eatery has come to the west valley and it brings back memories of my grandmother's cooking, we need these types of restaurants in the west valley.

_KVqknpzIiUkupSqE9LOSg.text: I love this place. Very authentic. Food is marvelous!!  Only complaint is the restaurant is small. I hope they expand!!

Ff6tMH9WWTHeqYCMg-WWLw.text: We have been to Fabio's about 7 times since they opened the food is delicious but the portions are extremely small for the amount of money they charge we decided to have pizza this week it was cold limp no crunch to the crust and we asked to have it left in oven extra time to get crust crisp very disappointing they seem very unorganized when busy it's very loud and crowded. Franco worries more about his tip than service he provides.  Fabio has a gold mined but he needs to make sure it's running perfectly when he is gone.

_H0xsvfvJIVyT_7xqHtM0g.text: It was just ok. The bread was good. The tiramisu was good. The sauce didn't do it for me. If I have to add salt and pepper to everything, I'm not going back. I didn't even finish my dinner. Bummer. I wanted to love you!

p3yBzRXrtyQ0T6aUWy2uiw.text: went here with my boyfriend a while back and it was amazing! walked into a very friendly, homey environment with very nice people. the owner was amazing, our waiter suggested a bunch of wonderful foods. overall great experience, amazing service, absolutely loved it.

OtlXJhMXlH1eXH0hKTMihA.text: 4 stars because folks should definitely check this place out. Peoria needs more creative and unique restaurants like this, so let's support them. There a couple of things to know before you go. The service is extremely charming and is very much a part if the experience, though it was a bit schizophrenic when we were there. Wine bottle was delivered to our table, but server didn't have a wine key, then server frantically gets food out for another table, then server returns with a wine key to find that the wine bottle has been taken by another server...and so on. This is really almost culinary theater, and it's fun if you're not in a rush. The wrong salad came out, but was quickly corrected, which was great because the strawberry salad is amazing! The food was really good overall, we didn't try the pizza, but will be back. There was another issue with which the staff sort of fumbled, but it's not worth detailing, as it really came down to inconsiderate customers more than anything else. Definitely check this place out!

qmd_3YB4HXBh0dAsTK7vWg.text: A great addition to our neighborhood restaurant scene. A real family affair, with tasty home style cooking. It would be a 5 star place when they get the facility up to speed. Third visit today, continue to be consistently good, even if the facility needs work.

UIvnNbuOmZAjSjaqmJZeuA.text: LOVE it. never had a bad meal here. when i took my aunt she said she's never had better pizza, and she's travelled through Italy. perfect place to take someone you want to impress. love the employees, the atmosphere, the food, everything.

44fhbrEZQfW5yerinUp8Xw.text: Had gnocchi with pesto, lobster ravioli (special), Roasted rack of lamb with potatoes, and the Diavolo pizza.  I wasnt a huge fan of anything but the pizza and our server is the reason Im giving this place 4 stars. Rafael was the greatest server I might have had in the history of eating out. He made everything sound fantastic!!   The sauce on the lobster ravioli was very fishy. I couldnt eat more than a small bite. The pesto on the gnocchi was a tad bland.  The lamb was ok, but im not a huge fan of lamb so I shouldnt really critique it. I did enjoy the pizza with spicy salami.  I would DEFINTELY go back though and try different things on the menu as Rafael made the dining experience simply amazing. Felt like being at home with my Italian family. I even told the owner he needs a raise.  The prices were VERY reasonable but the portions are not very large. We were a party of 3 and ordered 3 entrees and one pizza and split everything. Overall, it was a great dining experience.

LyEQg-bZlOH9_7crYyrEyA.text: Will be back again and again  Lobster ravioli is the best! Hand made pastas  Cook everything in front of you so you know its fresh and  not boxed! Gelato is the best as well!!! Gotta try this place y'all

9rAJmUOr6pAjsVerj49tzA.text: This food is wonderful!  We had the lobster ravioli -- very flavorful and the antipasta beforehand was a treat.  We will definitely be returning for this fine dining experience.  Great service, too!

NYfY4E2MdnvQK7nI763PrA.text: Fantastic!  I had the short rib ravioli with a cream sauce that was absolute perfection! Others in our party ordered the pasta bolognese, eggplant Parmesan, and a few pizzas. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals The house made bread is truly authentic Italian.... nice and crusty on the outside while soft and chewy inside!  My only issue with the food is that for the price,it should include a salad. Fabio needs to open a larger restaurant. The seating is crammed in there so you're really sitting on top of each other and end up having dinner with someone you don't know because the tables are pretty much right next to each other.  We would definitely go there a lot more often if there was more seating. If you haven't been, this is a must if you desire delicious Italian food, but don't mind being crammed in like sardines.

L-25lnQa9pn-xUP0baOgRQ.text: We received the friendly Italian family welcome upon arrival and departure. The made from  scratch meatballs and pizza was very very good. Gelato..well just plain delicious!

rjvc7avWaVQcjRTjzFi5Wg.text: Went to the restaurant and it was semi busy. Waited forever to talk to someone about a table. Was told over an hour wait. They had tables open and no one sitting in them. This place is small and little pricey for what it is. They lack customer service skills. I would say it's trying to be upscale in a small location and are out of their league.

C17lD2jj6Mb6UTaTK6JlDw.text: This is one of the finest Italian restaurants in Phoenix.  Small crowded with great friendly waitpersons who really know the menu and the specials.  Food is like home my wife's pizza was excellent and my pasta with meat sauce was great.  We will return on a regular basis.    Another great meal and the most friendly place in town

mpncDZuMQO_gNeQh-OKfKQ.text: I could never say anything wrong about any of the food here very appetizing but let me tell you service was ALL WRONG made me very mad ONLY because I watched this older little lady server ( Fiorella ) severing 10 tables ALL by herself, She was giving the best service doing the most she could do, we watched her run back & forth to every table checking to make sure everyone was good but when your serving 10 tables it takes a lot of time. As I also watched one other worker that was working on the floor just standing around not welcoming customers in, doing the least possible, She had a ear pod in her ear looking on her phone meanwhile their tables that I see looking around for more drinks / bread / checks. It was all simple tasks that any worker could've done so it doesn't matter what job position you have when you see your business getting busy that when you gotta start working harder. Thanks to Fiorella for showing off her hardworking skills such a great server !

4UVspvNDSqwv9xJ6DYLDWw.text: Fabio on Fire is a highlight of our trips to Peoria. The food is spectacular, delicious, sophistacted! But as amazing as the food is it is the atmosphere that is the most special. The staff is joyous, attentive, knowledgeable. They remember you when you come back and make you feel like family. Last night was my husband's birthday and the entire waitstaff gathered around our table and launched into a professional quality round of Happy Birthday in Italian and then English. I'm talking the bus boys, the hostess and Fabio himself. So amazing.  This place is special and I can't say enough about it. Try it out.

q-97iH4fdquGbGw9TMGRNw.text: We had heard great things about this restaurant and finally decided to give it a try. Well, let me tell you, we were missing out because it definitely lived up to the hype! The delicious food was complemented perfectly by the outstanding customer service and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. Every member of the staff went out of their way to ensure we were served promptly and attended to our every need. Even on a busy Friday night! The owner was gracious and friendly, interacting with every table and making us laugh. They sang happy birthday in Italian to the table next to us and you could just see the enjoyment on their faces. Everyone was having a great time. And did I mention the wonderful food?! My husband and I started with an incredible appetizer and a bottle of Sangiovese. The appetizer was a generous portion of buffalo mozzarella with prosciutto, arugula, and tomatoes, drizzled with balsamic. It was one of the specials for the evening, but I hope we get the opportunity to have it again because, wow! Simply unforgettable. Next we shared the pear salad. It was light and crisp, with just a drizzle of lemon vinaigrette, so we could really taste the fresh ingredients. Next was the main course. If you like wood fired pizza, this is your place! So many to choose from! The made-from-scratch pastas and other entrees all sounded amazing too, but we decided on the pizza. I can't remember the name of it, but it was topped with black olives, prosciutto, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and mozzarella. We loved the combination of flavors and let me tell you, the sauce and crust were perfection! Maybe the best I've had anywhere. Last, but not least was dessert...yep, we really went for it. But I am so glad we did because we decided on a strawberry mille-feuille; light, flaky pastry layered with Chantilly cream and strawberries on top. It. Was. Heaven! I'm actually regretting sharing that one! The whole meal was wonderful from start to finish and I commend the owners for bringing this gem to the west valley. Exactly the kind of place we needed and one I'm more than happy to support. We will definitely be back soon and spread the word to all of our family and friends. Thank you again for a wonderful experience!

LcZLllvdKyZcJ_UqrSHodQ.text: This place is so many adjectives for just the word AMAZING! The atmosphere is welcoming as soon as you walk through the threshold. Not only do you feel a sense of authentic, but it's also family oriented, great for date night, even a single lunch to visit. The bread with oil & vinegar is a superb presentation & tastes perfectly baked. I am addicted to the butternut squash pasta! The sauce is impeccable, it's cooked just right & it's the appropriate portion for complete bliss in your belly. The desserts-- there are so many to choose from!! I usually get an assortment of cookies just to take home. I'm ecstatic I can take my kids here & have a wonderful meal, in a warm atmosphere. Go try this excellent restaurant!

jLiW9EHpBGVFKRBpfQpzBw.text: Holy crap an awesome restaurant that's not a chain in my neighborhood?  Who knew that was possible?  I was reading the latest restaurant review expecting it to be in the hip 7th street corridor and was shocked that it was around the corner from my home.  So off we went to experience this delightful Italian restaurant.  I highly recommend the lasagna.  I adore it!  It makes me very happy. But the Short Rib Ravioli is the best!  You should go there now!

t4bL0O0bFmzrQFLrGG62gg.text: My first visit and won't be my last.  Stopped in with my wife Sunday afternoon. Appetizer, Arancini, was fantastic. My wife had Short Rib Ravioli and I had the Gnocci.  The food is 5 star along with the wine. Thank you for a fantastic meal.

hwPW6EoIQXMmX1VHheGzCw.text: Really good food and service!  Their pizza is Italian style, which is a lot different then our pizza here in the states.  Did not care for it near as much as their pasta dishes.  Overall great experience and would go back!

J93VEWWctuI24c6GtFLjeQ.text: This place is a gem  Great ambience, really friendly staff, and the most delicious Italian food!

63DVNifDK5-6Nf7xELyFHg.text: Fantastic meal here. We started with the Burrata which was very nicely presented. The Burrata was very fresh. She had the Polenta board with sausage in a rustic tomato sauce. I had the short rib ravioli in an Alfredo sauce. I would highly recommend either dish! The service was great and Chef Fabio was even running plates and chatting with each table. The house Red was a Chianti for $28 a bottle. Decent table wine. Went just fine with the food.

TjRUdzk3unvMPCP4gc6FFA.text: Amazing staff, amazing entrees. Highly recommend.   The atmosphere is small and intimate but that doesn't take away from the experience at all. This is a great small business that has come to the West Side.   The short rib ravioli are to die for! A+!

D37PEje6fQIM84YKSZl6Cw.text: There's no denying the Italian legitimacy of Fabio on Fire. And in an area like Peoria, which is largely considered a culinary joke in comparison to Central Phoenix or Scottsdale, it's definitely a welcoming addition. I've dined at Fabio's on multiple occasions since they first opened, including their very first week of operation. I've watched their popularity rapidly grow to the point where I often question if this particular location is the best choice for what it is they're trying to accomplish.  I'll be honest here. On a good night, Fabio's pizza and pasta are easily comparable to some of the better Italian restaurants you can find in Phoenix. Their butternut squash ravioli, for example, is spectacular when done properly, putting most restaurant's take on the dish to complete shame. On a bad night, however, such as what happened to us recently, the dish was so overwhelming salty that neither myself nor my girlfriend had any desire to finish it.  Their pizzas are stellar and made in that traditional Neapolitan style that I've always preferred. The "Best outside of Italy" or "Best in the U.S." Yelp claims are a bit far-fetched and eye-roll inducing, but for this particular area, it's easily one of the better choices you'll be able to find.  For dessert, they have excellent gelato, as well as a variety of Italian pastries and cookies that are on bakery-styled shelves. Nothing is labeled, but Fabio and company will explain everything if you ask. Some cookies I like more than others, but that's just personal preference. They're good when fresh, but suck when stale. I've experienced both.  What I think hurts Fabio's dining experience for customers, despite actually helping the business itself, is that the place was quickly outed to the locals to the point where Fabio's can quickly transform into a complete zoo when the joint gets slammed. The building isn't really set up well for a sit-down restaurant. Tables are all incredibly close together, servers can barely maneuver around, and it's not uncommon to go largely ignored for long periods of time. When moderately full, the coziness and intimacy works fine, but when large parties decide to dine here, it clogs up the restaurant and makes for a bit of a messy experience. Recently, my girlfriend and I checked in and were quoted 45 minutes for a table. The wait almost ended up being triple, yes, triple that time - clocking in at almost 2.5 hours! Granted, the absurdly large party of 20 diners might have had something to do with it, but when your estimates are off by that much, it might be time to rethink things.  Their whole iPad checkout process is very weird. One of the servers comes by and will simply swipe your card when you're ready to leave, without even giving you the opportunity to look at the actual bill. This is not really an ideal setup for a restaurant, as any billing mistakes will inevitably end up going unnoticed.   My feelings remain mixed. I'm glad that Fabio's is doing well, because their success might help other businesses and chefs realize that West Valley residents are begging for better restaurant options. But the lackluster service on busy nights quickly reveals why I feel that they still have a lot to learn about how to execute on a high level.   I'll be interested to see how Fabio evolves over time. But for now, I'd still give them a solid recommendation. Just hope that you're there on one of their "good" nights and you'll be fine.
