QTUt4EGccshyZ9uF-p_x4Q.text: So fabulous!! Everything we had was wonderful!! We had the pork belly appetizer, gnocchi, and the special which was fish and roasted potatoes and tomatoes. We ordered the cookies and a cappuccino for dessert!! Highly recommend the 12 cookies for $5 and the pork belly appetizer. The hummus was the best I ever had!! I am very excited to return and try the pizza and get more hummus!! Great service, we had Fiorella as our waitress. She was adorable and added fun to the whole dining experience!! I highly recommend the great little restaurant in Peoria!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

aVqzznWaZKUdGixsRiIHig.text: This little Italian restaurant is the real deal folks. I almost don't want to talk about it because it'll get more crowded than it already is but I can't keep it a secret because that would be unfair.  The Capriocciosa pizza was amazing. It had San Marzano tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, artichoke hearts, prosciutto, olives, basil, and EVOO (extra virgin olive oil). It's funny because I'm not a huge fan of artichoke anything unless it's in a dip and not the biggest fan of olives BUT I loved this pizza. The artichoke hearts were soft and velvety and so easy to eat. The olives were a perfect slightly salty type of delicious. I actually looked for them and ate them when they fell off my slices.   Next time I think I'll try the Tarantina which had the same first two ingredients but then had spicy salami, Gorgonzola, and white caramelized onions. I would've tried all 11 of them last night but couldn't fit it all in!   The veal meatball appetizer was so flavorful and served with freshly baked bread. They had fresh rosemary in a pot on the table so you can pick off the rosemary and sprinkle some in olive oil on your appetizer plate and salt it.   The ravioli is hand made daily every morning. Wait, I'm wrong. Every pasta dish is made this way. They sold out of the butternut squash ravioli so we had to settle for the veal and beef ravioli. Poor us, right? It was unbelievable. They also had a lobster ravioli available but my friend and guitar teacher, Pat, who had recommended the veal in such high regards. He is one of the most Italian people I know so we had to go with veal. Pat also recommends the eggplant entree but again, we'd have to try that next time.  Our waitress Fiorella was one of the sweetest, warmest people I've ever met. She was personable and made us laugh and when she spoke in Italian with other staff members, it really did feel like I was invited to a family dinner in Italy. When I was eating that amazing looking and tasting pistachio cannoli, she said, "I'm not going to tell you how to eat it, but you should just use your hands," and gave us no forks for the cannoli. She is the best!   They have a smorgasbord of Italian pastries. You can get a box and just pick and choose an assortment of what you like. Everyone seemed to after they finished their dinners. We were the only ones that didn't since we just ate that huge cannoli.  Like any awesome restaurant, it's busiest on weekends and the service may be a bit slower. During the week, like on a Tuesday, it's just perfect our waitress said. It's not super fancy or anything but you definitely feel like you're getting a fabulous home cooked authentic Italian meal and experience when you come here. You'd think the pizzas would be the stand out but the pasta may be the real standout. You decide!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Pistachio cannoli
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Capricciosa Pizza (tomato sauce, mozzarella, artichoke hearts, prosciutto, olives, basil, EVOO)
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Veal and beef ravioli

HDtN9x7JJFSBUeL0YEt8sg.text: This is a very busy place. Excellent food, friendly staff and they do anything possible to please the customer.  I am so glad to have this top rated jewel in the  best city, Peoria, Arizona.

X5UhD35Jx246_vEkWmdqFQ.text: Excellent visit on a Sunday lunch.  No crowds at all!  This is a small venue and I can see how it may get a bit noisy when bustling, but our "off peak" hours timing was perfect.    I shared the Butternut Ravioli and Pear Salad with my Mom.  The ravioli was AMAZING as many others have also stated, so definitely give it a try.  The pear salad, served with a lemon vinaigrette, was a bit plain on the dressing.  (Personally, I'd prefer to see a bit more lemon juice and zest, and perhaps a dash of white pepper, to spruce it up more, as it was very mild.)  The greens were fresh and the pear perfectly ripe, so the produce was not at fault.  Because of that, I wouldn't hesitate to try a different salad next time.  I prefer strong flavors and spice; so if your preferences lean mild it might be something you like.   Another person in our party had a sandwich, which was huge, and he liked it but I didn't try as I was too stuffed to take another bite, so I am not able to review that.  He was unable to finish it all and had a huge portion to take home.  Regretfully, I also didn't have room to try dessert.  Our server was terrific, totally flawless.  Warm and knowledgeable.  She was great.    I think this is a nice place to try if you're a bit tired of chain restaurants and looking for a fresh Italian menu to try.   I think next time I might share a pizza, in an attempt to save room to sample the tiramisu.  They are only open for lunch on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday but check it out for that if you're in the area those days.  (Especially if you want to avoid crowds and enjoy a quiet visit, our server told us Saturday night was very busy!)

8Naa_8EkgAOEN0UpdeDulw.text: This is a great place to casually dine on the West Side. We've ordered for pick up, Door Dashed and dined in early on a Friday evening. Service is slow but the food is great. I love that there are gluten free options for pizza. Best gluten free crust I've ever had. Ever. Bubbles up like a crust should. The produce is fresh and I'm glad Fabio supports local.   When we dined in, my daughter had the butternut squash ravioli which was to die for. Portions were large enough to share. My husband had the lobster ravioli, which was ok as the portion size left him still hungry. Bread was ok. Food came out promptly after we ordered but we had issues with the hostess. She sat us inside when we asked to be seated outside and never brought us our menus. I saw the hostess bussing tables and touching dirty dishes then passing out water. It was a zoo. I'm sure this happens elsewhere.   We've had the Diavola pizza and sausage and fungi pizza-both excellent and satisfying. We have also indulged in the cookies which were pretty good. The strawberry gelato was refreshing and delicious.   Quality of food makes up for the hospitality that still needs to be ironed out.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Kid&#39;s pizza. Portion size same as regular pizzas!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Dozen cookies for $5
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Vegetable pizza

rxIsIFfq9M83CHi_AX5FQQ.text: My wife and I saw this restaurant featured on Plate & Pour and were excited to choose it for Valentines Day. Great food. Loved the pizzas. The place was packed on a wet romantic Thursday afternoon and found the food outstanding with a caring staff that really showed how much they valued our business. We will return soon.

lScq45i_RxYZmy7gkTe0Tg.text: Awesome place for good food and smiling service!  Do recommend!  The lamb was cooked perfectly.  The gnocchi melted in my mouth!  The desserts were heavenly!  The atmosphere is great, airy, clean.  Very romantic at night.  Great for impressing family or date nights!

QJOybRYHNv0egAfbuRyWnA.text: So, the name got my attention, the menu got my interest, and the food got my vote.   OMG this place is amazing.  Coming from an Italian family from NYC, i am a bit skeptical of Italian dining.  Wow were we pleasantly surprised.  One of the best places I know, and thier deserts may be even better than the main course.  The strawberry gelato was enough to come back for on its own.  Now to the service.  Nothing short of perfect. They work together as a team and my table was never in want for anything.

1D89bz5KCM443EfZLEqVlQ.text: Visited Fabio on Fire on Sunday April 28 for a birthday celebration with a few close friends.  Our server was Fiorella.  Ask for her by name.  She is the best server I can recall ever having.  I don't eat out much but when I do service is mostly average.  Fiorella reviewed the entire menu with us and made suggestions going into great description.  She was so helpful and accommodating.  She served with a smile that would light up any room.  Thank you Fiorella:)

RBdXBXqQ1_q7f4U3mYa9DQ.text: What a delight.  Fabio's has everything great food, wonderful atmosphere, terrific service.  We shared a pizza, then had two pastas.  We ordered a couple of pizza for friends at home and they enjoyed them as much as we did.  We're putting Fabio's on our favorite list.

Hy_QS0ivlb2rALvjpOks2Q.text: Absolutely delicious, we will be back.  Fabio and his team were very friendly and just awesome.  Such a wonderful first time experience, the two kids enjoyed as well. Gnocchi bolognese was fantastic.   Next time either butternut squash ravioli or prosciutto fungi abundante mozzarella pizza!

rNH4sSOuJicsvVzxxNd-Eg.text: We have had many meals at Fabio on Fire and have never been disappointed.  The food is consistently exceptional.  However, this review is about a catered event that Fabio did for our family last Saturday.  We had more than 60 friends and family to our home to celebrate a special family event.  Fabio brought his wood-fired pizza oven to our home and served made-to-order pizza, fresh salad, and bruschetta.  Our friends loved having a chance to see how their pizza was made and Fabio did not disappoint.  He and his team were fantastic!  They interacted with everyone at our party and made everyone feel special.  In fact, our guests were so entranced that many of them spent much of their time at the pizza oven in our driveway watching Fabio make pizza!  The pizzas were great and obviously very fresh and the salad and bruschetta were as good as what you are served at Fabio on Fire.  If you ever need to feed a large number of party guests, give Fabio a call and have him bring his wood fired pizza oven to your home!  It was great fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Fabio and his wood-fired pizza oven!

z-aZiJQ172NTB0GWwduGXQ.text: The worst dining experience I've had in years.  The food is fair, but the service is awful. We're not going back.

Sbc9SdNMSBCFoAU5qovXkg.text: We keep enjoying this neighborhood gem! Fabio and his team are the friendliest people, make you feel like family from the moment you arrive at this darling restaurant/pizzeria. The food match the welcoming atmosphere ! Love the pizza, we always get at least one, the fresh mozzarella is divine, bread amazing! Every entree we've tried has been so delicious, maybe the ravioli is our favorite? The best tiramisu ever and they give little cookies to our grandchildren. Just ate there last night and can't wait to go back next week. Never disappoints! Fabio has an amazing story, if you can get him to stop working so hard. Love him, his mom and the whole staff. Thanks for another great evening at your restaurant! Grazie!

cYn7ynTdGyiOJlG3oKY5EQ.text: This restaurant sits in a really unassuming strip mall in Peoria. Please don't let that fool you. This restaurant could compete with some of the best neighborhood Italian restaurants in the country.  I went with a couple of friends and we got a few things to share.   The pasta is freshly made ... and you can tell. Excellent quality. We also got a couple of appetizers.  The tomato with burrata was amazing. Also, had the meatballs in a marinara sauce. It too was really good.   We shared a pizza too which had such quality ingredients and a fantastic taste.   The meal was finished with a canoli.    I'm from Chicago. My mother is Sicilian.  I feel confident that I know great Italian food and this is it.  Nothing pretentious,  very casual and neighborhoody.  Fabio himself is making pizzas and greeting customers with his broad grin and wonderfully inviting Italian accent.   This is what dining out should be. Quality, fresh, reasonably priced and so welcoming.

H5cU9X_Ak2Beo-vGiflOFA.text: Finally found a genuine Italian restaurant. Both my parents were born in Italy. Great pizza  and cheese antipasto plate. Looking forward to my next visit this week to try other dishes.   Giuseppe

OLgNqRUhCiD396fDftT-7w.text: Just amazing authentic Italian food. Big portions, reasonable prices. Homemade bread, pasta and desserts. This place is the best!!!

MHSFOo7HP0G6EHbMvr2bRw.text: Loved it! We were able to make a reservation for a group of 9  of us. The initial service of drinks and taking food orders was very prompt, however getting our food was a slow. Not extreme though, and it was worth the wait. Their pizza menu is more extensive than their pasta menu, with only 4 or 5 pasta dishes listed, but everything we had was delicious, from the strawberry salad, Bianca Parma pizza (white pizza), lasagna and butternut ravioli, to the cannoli. My only suggestion would that they serve some olive oil & balsamic vinegar for dipping with the delicious bread they put on the table when you're seated.

Ijs0W7MZPNGNYEjG552GXw.text: Everything was delicious!  We just came from our first, but definitely not last, visit to Fabio on Fire. We usually don't go for Italian anyplace except Tomaso's but I had heard good things about Fabio on Fire and it is much closer to our house.  We were not disappointed!  We started with the meat and cheese appetizer platter which was scrumptious, along with the bread they bring. We all had different main meals and we all sampled each other's. My butternut squash ravioli was amazing. My son ate every bit of his beef short rib ravioli, my husband had sausage and broccolini ravioli, our daughter-in-law the tagliatelle bolognase, and our grandson the kids pepperoni pizza. Not one of us said we wouldn't order our meals again. For dessert we tried the cannoli, tiramisu, and a strawberry and a chocolate gelato, and we just passed them all around and made mmmmm, so good noises. We are already planning our next visit!

lXw_uXohSXSjYSr8oBKmkA.text: Excellent food, excellent service, amazing specials!!' Super authentic, nice to have non chain places to dine on the west side!!

30mQ8B0R_Oo7ifSJ_kMFBQ.text: This place is a rare find in West Valley! Very authentic. It is small so don't expect a huge space. If you want amazing food, and service please visit Fabio On Fire! Not a chain restaurant. The owners will make you feel very special. I had the Spinach Ravioli! Oh my! It was delicious. You will love the food and experience!

w7HmRplXDY1anrpWI-SgJQ.text: Food is simply delicious!! Everything is made fresh. The cookies OH MY GOSH they just melt in your mouth. Friendly staff & I love the fact that it is family owned. I will be back & definitely recommend it!

DSiht7JIDlIqu_6wtDTOgA.text: I was very impressed with the quality of the food and service.  Most of the staff are from Italy and Truely infuse a piece of Italy into each dish.  We ordered a large pear salid, gluten free pizza, and eggplant parmesan and ate family style.  It was so delicious!  We finished it off with thier in house Tiramisu and an Italian cappuccino which was spot on!  In the end we bought a variety of Biscotti, and cookies for later.  They are in the process of applying for a liquor license, so until then you'll have to drink water, tea, or an Italian soda.

XOiGJ7g-RpbZxkqPaxBtLg.text: Recently got to try this pizza, and it was delicious. Crisp crust, sauce was on point and the cheese pull. Tell you what, ill follow this food truck. If i ever need some catering done, im having these guys do it! Thumbs up, five stars. No less. Thanks for bringing me back to the east coast with a single bite. Dank!

jk6Gq1OkdlGT2JwDOtDShA.text: Great food.  Good service.  Small Italian restaurant serving excellent food.  Next time pizza from that amazing oven. We will be back.

YeC7_KfXLYrG-r7oXm0b5Q.text: This is the most amazing Italian restaurant, it is not your typical generic italian, this is like eating from a real italians kitchen. The raviolis are superb and the sauces are some of the best ive had. The pizza's are great also. The staff is hilarious and friendly. The specials dont change too often so if there is one you like you shoukld be able to get it again. There are not many tables, so be sure to call a head or check their website for the wait list.

Mvos0x-V4pt_p8RcvZzgbA.text: Great service and delicious food.  Great little spot but arrive early, seating is limited. Perfect family run Italian restaurant. Happy that the westside is finally getting better food places!

hhKnXnS6j5y45OGKQSsMiQ.text: Friendly service Great atmosphere...But seriously let's talk about the food...by far THE best Italian restaurant in the west valley.  A little bit pricier than what you might pay for chain Italian ...but what do you expect when it's all homemade by authentic Italians!

or20GV5PmwpWO0osoyIXFA.text: FABIO on Fire now has a restaurant it is fantastic!!!! 8275 W Lake Pleasant Parkway  You will not be disappointed.

Z1GjUdMUXOcEISQnl_scVw.text: Real Italian food in a small strip mall restaurant! We had the meatballs and a pizza. Homemade meatballs that literally melted in my mouth. It was crazy good. The pizza crust was perfect! I will pick different toppings next time as the artichokes didn't provide the flavor we thought it would. Friendly staff and very attentive! We found a new favorite!

hlgHDelkjpIXHMJhw7aLzw.text: Very good pizza.  Place was packed but service was great!!!  Definitely recommend and will go back!

Be9lWhy3PpkRlGxShQ9Gzg.text: Excellent food, authentic Italian, service is great, our server was very courteous and very helpful, all in all it was an excellent experience.

lZizpuWyIj1Ok6CT_UULvg.text: Fabio is amazing! Every time its so delicious! Small restaurant so you may have to wait a bit for a table...but we also get it To Go and it's still yummy.

ThjtwVpOirTKc30bhhs3Sw.text: Great food great service can't complain. Nothing in this area is any better. Tons of wine to choose from!! You won't be disappointed that's for sure.

_TO39UGFSkvGgENrnoH0IQ.text: This is our second review of Fabio's--and our fifth or sixth lunch and/or dinner. Today, for lunch, we had the bruschetta with FRESH buffalo cheese plus an artisan pizza with Italian salami and caramelized onions. As always, a wonderful combination of flavors and textures. Fabio's is our favorite restaurant -- great staff and Fabio knows how to treat customers.  Update 10/20: Today we had the salami and caramelized onion pizza again PLUS the antipasto with hot and mild Italian salami, mortadella, cheeses including mascarpone cheese with walnuts, olives, and more. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

IpuQIfSsNdD0GWTQE-jOKQ.text: Just moved into the neighborhood and stopped here for lunch to give it a try and so glad I did.  The staff was wonderful and the food was out of this world.  Think I just found my new favorite Italian restaurant!!

K46S8ib5ZpYjq_zs21ZH8Q.text: Very good hidden gem in a strip mall which is too bad because the food is above that location. The butternut squash ravioli was really good as was the crusty bread and wine. My friend had the lobster special but there was very little lobster in it. I must say though that make sure you stand you ground and eat at your leisure and don't let them rush you. It is very small and you can make a reservation on their site to get an approximate time. I think a nice Italian restaurant should reflect the family like feeling of wanting to stay and enjoy the food. We wanted to enjoy our dinner but our waiter actually handed my friend a to go box before she even asked for one. After we ordered dessert, we could feel him hovering around us so he could give us the check. They check you out at the table which also isn't very classy. My friend wanted to pay in cash and when he said how much tip she said a number, 20%, and he said well then that would be $9 not $8. He then asked if she wanted change! She would have gotten money back but she felt so flustered she said no. If someone is going to put out high end food then make the atmosphere and the servers reflect it. I would only order to go.

SnNV7Fet-jx9vLqgVIo97A.text: We had such an uncomfortable, horrible experience here, my husband and I. I had to write a review after my husbands review. Long story short came in with a friend. The person seating us (not the owner)  noticed my husband was a little annoyed when we were sat at the bar. The man seating us in a very condescending manor explained to my husband how reservations worked. Unbelievable. Then he stood at the bar in front of me so he could hear what we were saying. I don't know if he was in a horrible mood that day but he was very aggressive and just condescending. He clearly did not like my husband. So we were like okay.. maybe the food will be great. Man what a disappointment the food was wow. It was just BLAND. We've been to Italy, we've been to other Italian restaurants and so far we've never had food this tasteless. He was condescending the entire night, treating my husband like complete crap. He turns to me and says, "ma'am, would you like some dessert?" Then turns to my husband as if he doesn't know what dessert is and says, "sweets." Definitely not coming back here. You want good Italian food? Probably go anywhere else but here and make sure that condescending man doesn't think you're upset because he will berate you the entire night. They need to FIRE that guy.

__-kR0kfil-ADkYxYUf-pQ.text: Joined another couple at 1:00pm on Saturday afternoon. Was able to get a table right away. I'd heard it wd be a long wait in the evening. We sat on patio. Quiet, clean and comfortable although one person in our party switched from hard wood chair to an upholstered one. In all we had butternut ravioli, lobster and crab ravioli, antipasto plate, pear/arugula salad. ALL were delicious! The bread basket was filled twice we enjoyed it so much!!  This is definitely a "go back to" place!

b6KTeJCsoGqOBZg97QB2rQ.text: This is going to be a long review, so please grab a seat!  We have been HUGE fans of Fabio ever since meeting him in 2013. We were very fortunate to have him cook for us in our home, spinning pizzas and baking his delicious biscotti. We fell in love with his amazing bread, and have never been the same!  When we heard Fabio was opening a restaurant we were "over the moon".  Tonight we celebrated a special birthday and Fabio and his family at "Fabio on Fire" made it extra special.  For our first course we ordered the "grande" appetizer platter. Many different cheeses and meats with olives and grapes and that delicious bread. Be careful, you'll want to devour every morsel, and like me, may decide to order an extra serving of my favorite cheese, pecorino peppercorn.  Note: I've searched for this cheese for many years ... so to find it served on the cheese platter tonight, I was overjoyed.  Since there were 7 of us, I won't detail every dish, but two of the highlights were: the bolognese lasagna and the artichoke & prosciutto pizza. I could only eat 1 slice as I knew I had to leave room for dessert.  OMG ... Fabio's homemade gelato, chocolate, vanilla and strawberry and his limoncello sorbet. I defy you to find a better tasting gelato in the entire country. In fact, I know a thing or two about gelato, haven eaten it 3 times per day when I was in Rome (that's 7 days x 3 = 21 servings of gelato) and I can truly say Fabio's gelato is THE best!  My partner is a purist and only eats vanilla gelato, but I like to live "dangerously" by eating chocolate and strawberry together in the same bowl. Vivevla difference! LOL  One spoonful and you will flip out on the unbelievable fresh taste of Fabio's gelato! Then there's his Italian pastries. Too many to list, but I'm going with my favorite: pistachio cannoli.   In short, visit Fabio on Fire soon ... before everyone discovers it and you won't be able to get a reservation. Your taste buds will thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t miss the lemon sorbetto. It&#39;s delicioso!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. The BEST bread on the planet. I should know, I&#39;ve basically tried every crusty Italian loaf I can find and Fabio&#39;s is indeed the best!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. The chocolate and strawberry gelato are NOT to be missed!

jdobHz7jtrxaPgeSBvCOkw.text: Found this gem!   It's authentic Italian food.  The service is wonderful and the setting is comfortable.  You will not be disappointed.

1kfsUr2-eBw524ciVBJQjQ.text: Wow.  Such a decadent experience. A very personal, high quality restaurant.  Small, quaint and a few tables in an outside, covered area as well. We dined outside.. It was a rainy day so they lit the propane  tower heaters to create a warm, cozy atmosphere.  The chairs have large, comfortable seats with pretty, fabric tie on cushions. A nice touch. Nice music playing.   Beautiful food with only the best ingredients.  This is authentic Italian fare. Seafood, lamb, pasta....Nice wines, unique dessert, everything was delicious!  I am gf, df, nightshade free! An allergy nightmare! And they accomodated me with the most exquisite pizza I have ever had the pleasure of dining upon.  The crust was thin, crisp and PERFECT.  The toppings --  there are no words. Absolutely above and beyond.  It was one of those experiences that has you living completely in the moment, savoring each bite. If you want to be carried away to Italy for an evening, this is the place!  Show up early. In general they do not take reservations.

VoNwk2Y0RQkgaCAaWJhBAg.text: Great food great service! My husband had the short rib ravioli and I had the cioppino   Outstanding pasta and sauces. Wood fired pizza looked amazing-we will be back to try soon!

fmeehFjUAFCh7xZHMn10CQ.text: Had an amazing experience at this little gem. It felt very authentic from the food to the culture and vibe of the restaurant. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and happy to guide us and give us suggestions when asked. The food is home made and they even have fresh from scratch pasta and sauces as well as desserts. Great experience I highly recommend. The only caveat is that it is very small and they do not take reservations, but most definitely worth the wait!

O_3A_No5xtmdih51d6ZQoA.text: Hands-down best Italian food place ...definitely on this side of town ...possibly in all of Phoenix. We ordered a lot and tried the bufalina pizza, the beef and veal tortellini, and the lamb on special. Another must try is the pistachio cannoli, the strawberry pastry puff dessert and of course the wine. The service was amazing and Franco was an absolute delight. You can taste all of the fresh ingredients in everything they make. My new favorite place! Thank you for doing Italian so well!

KiMvYF4E0KmHhbdw2Ktfug.text: First time to Fabio's.  I took my family for dinner to celebrate my mother's birthday.  Let me start by saying my wife is Italian, first generation born in America.  We don't go out for Italian food...  Ever...  Where do I start..  Our server Franco was fantastic.  Eggplant parmesan was done perfectly which happens to be my wife's favorite. The cavatelli with brocolli and sausage also top notch.  Pizza and gnocchi also cooked to perfection.  PIzza is the closest to actual Napoledean pizza we have had in AZ.   Nice little Italian wine list and priced appropriately.    There is nothing close to this type of food in Glendale/Peoria let alone all of AZ.  Thank you Fabio and staff for a wonderful evening.  We will be back soon.

9idnDHgzRVyWmP4yswIfYw.text: The best Italian food I've had in Arizona. They offer many specials with a small seating area inside. Make sure to use their online waitlist on busy nights or call ahead. My husband and I went in on a Friday evening around 5pm. We ordered the traditional bruschetta, spinach ravioli, lobster ravioli, tiramisu, and a pistachio cannoli. All of these items were phenomenal and served faster than I've ever had food served before. We will definitely be back with friends and family in the near future.

jjfK5NIV9n7v-dTDM3RDXg.text: Great Italian cuisine! We had the specials short rib ravioli and spaghetti with mussels and shrimp, amazing flavors. Their tiramisu is to die for! Definitely recommend.

78KyxbzQGm-JaDgreqwZGA.text: Not only is the service top notched, the food is to dye for! Everything is made fresh while you enjoy your dining visit

qP7zXUI2sRYADjqMZL5z-g.text: Felt like we were seated at their family dinner table. The lamb was really good and the bruschetta was exactly what I was craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

xePSoimMjYwBRbfqAWnM8Q.text: Incredible! So thankful this place is here in Peoria. It is so desperately needed and I love it.

J2CnuZVIsa1dEqCBO7vLhQ.text: Went there with friends and did not have a very pleasant experience (unlike many previous visits).  Specifically, two of us ordered Osso Buco and it was dreadful!  The piece was very small and tough beyond description.  The waitress simply shrugged this off and offered no help.  Further, the price charged for this "nightly special" was outrageous!  We will not be going back....

Z39zOIcnl1f5jbnEOXVbuA.text: We have been wanting to try this restaurant for awhile and finally were able to check it out. We sat at the bar and after looking through the menu decide on the charcuterie board and a bottle of wine to start. Sitting at the bar we got to watch it being made, as well as the pizzas. We decided to order the sausage and mushroom pizza and the short rib ravioli for dinner and it didn't disappoint. SO good! Service was great and we enjoyed the atmosphere. Fabio was out and we got to tell him how much we loved it! We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Pizza and ravioli

jdZ_BHJCXyShq5qAA8jQWg.text: We have been there once... it's really great. The owner talking to diners and helping on the floor. Not your traditional Italian restaurant.

WO6fFYU0AhcTxVBGqy5uvw.text: What a fantastic dining experience! From first class service to five star food and culinary, we really enjoyed our dinner here. We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the kitchen. The chef was very personable and made sure everyone was taken care of, all while running the kitchen. We had the short rib ravioli and a pizza and both were extremely good. The ravioli was absolutely amazing and I can't stop thinking about it! Would highly recommend a dinner night here. Great food, lovely ambiance, all while staying nice and casual!

VeHaQT6xVWhg3BV_PKN8sA.text: I don't think I will ever be able to say enough good things about this restaurant. After my first experience here, I am in no way joking when I say we came back two more times the same week. The food is outstanding, the wine recommendations were paired wonderfully, the desserts are to.die.for. Not to mention the staff are all so welcoming, and the atmosphere is so quaint it really highlights the very best of Italian cuisine.

w0OuqOvWR6WPcH0426HDog.text: Wonderful, hand-crafted Italian food at a reasonable price.    No reservations accepted, but a waitlist exists online to help plan arrival.

MpUHR5y_kiWVa0Y-5P1DJw.text: Great food at this little local restaurant. Good wine selection and friendly service. Fabio walks around when he is not busy to say hello. I love the quality and creativeness of his food. Small dining area so call ahead or plan to dine early. We will go back often.

L-JrXOI4FOemjfX8TWHhpA.text: So I have to update my review. In my last review I said I would not go back because they closed with no warning, no note on the door, nor no message on their phone. I still think that was bad business and I was annoyed I drove that far away. However, I am so glad I changed my mind and stopped by today. I happen to be in the neighborhood though.  Holy heck in a hand basket, this place is freaking unbelievable! Easily the best place I have eaten at in Phx for wood fire style pizza. The owner chatted with me while I sat at the bar. The staff were amazing in the way they treated me. ( as if I was family) The bread they serve as an app is crazy good and the pizza is the best wood Fire, Artisan style pizza I have had here in Az. Finally,  the Tiramisu is incredible.   The only bad thing is the place is way too small, loud, and very cramped. I ate at the bar which was a tad better but I usually dislike bar service for dinner. However, it was not that bad. The tables are very close to each other and the place does not have many tables. It must be a nightmare to serve here. Maybe they will expand one day?  Fabio, it was a pleasure meeting and chatting with you. Your staff members are kind and friendly and your food is amazing! Thank you for an amazing experience.

H2CiqNw04olZtUHem2ds2A.text: More than impressed with this little gem. I had the butternut squash ravioli and it was to die for. Perfect serving size.   Service was beyond wonderful.   The kind of cooking they presented felt like you were being served a home cooked meal but elevated.   I loved that the cooks checked on us to make sure we enjoyed our meal and that we were being taken care of.   The wine was delicious definitely worth getting a bottle of wine and enjoying the moment.   You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

M18Jy2PEFMFQ6614xUyBFw.text: I really, really, want to keep this place a secret, but then it might go away.  We just had the most fantastic meal here on a Friday night. We loved everything about this place.  Sitting at the pizza bar is the way to go.  Employees were amazing, friendly and in a joyous mood. I haven't even got to the food yet.  Wife had a beautiful white pizza and I got the spaghetti special that had mussels and shrimp.  It truly was DELICIOUS.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

7ao2McfuMnTSY9e50aQjKQ.text: I'm italian and Fabio on Fire is my favorite italian restaurant in Arizona. The best ingredients, great service, amazing dishes and a wonderful atmosphere! If you want to try authentic Italian food this is the right place!

vTUUsLBuDUNOH-d5nriFlw.text: Went there for my birthday. The food was great (that is why it's 2stars) but the server was so rude. I feel so embarrassed coz my work family was there to celebrate it with me. My husband asking the server about what beer they have after telling him, the server walked out. He announced on the table that the tip should be 20%, we don't want to give him 20% coz he was terrible. Never ever going back to this place again. I was so excited for my co-workers to try this place coz i think it's a gem but not recommending this place at all. Terrible service and rude server.

9lxBxkT3deciKsZGpObuKg.text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant in the valley. Incredible, delicious meals that keep you coming back. The closest thing to Italy that I've found here. The service is caring, and so welcoming. Fabio the chef is an artist and his food is a masterpiece. The lasagna and pizzas are scrumptious! Always check out the specials for new culinary adventures.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

5S2GheQ9pykHoEDyEI0u1Q.text: Fantastic Italian food. Staff was great, good service! Ordered the seafood pasta and my husband had lobster linguine, both were the specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Seafood pasta

MxMWRVvF4ttP1YtrjuSXVw.text: A cute, intimate restaurant. It is a tight squeeze but it does have outdoor patio seating as well. We had the gnocchi with four cheeses and the special of the night (not on the menu) rack of lamb and potatoes. Tip: ask for the specials!   The lamb was cooked beautifully, full of juicy flavorful perfection. And the gnocchi was so creamy and savory.   We also ordered tiramisu and a cannoli. WOW. Amazingly fresh and not over powering with sweetness. Definitely recommend them.   The hostess and servers were all polite and made it a cozy family atmosphere. I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Cannoli and tiramisu
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Gnocchi with four cheeses

k25PbkFOkqslsu41xJmpWg.text: The owners, servers and hosts are very friendly.  You'll often see them walk around and say "ciao" hello and ask if everything is ok.  The place is quaint and has a brick oven.  To start we ordered the pear salad to share.  Also ordered the butternut squash ravioli and Salciccia e Funghi pizza.  It was so good!  I really wanted to make room for dessert but I was stuffed!  Definitely returning to this gem.

cml5PTjhIYBYdJZmw8Yfdw.text: Looking for a place to take someone on a first date, look no further! By far, this is the best place I've been to in a while. Although in a strip mall area, it felt very high class. The people we sat next to traveled from Paradise Valley to eat. Family owned by a family from Milan that speak Italian to the wait staff.   We had a party of three and ordered the following:   Rib ravioli  Lasagna  Lobster pasta   All three were amazing in their own way. The ravioli and lasagna was the best I've had in a long time. The Lobster pasta wasn't my favorite but for those that love hardly any or light sauce, this is perfect for you. Everything is served at warm or room temperature so if you like it piping hot, make sure you ask for it in advance.   The owner pulled out my seat for me and makes you feel like family and speaks to you just the same. So if you're looking for fake service, go elsewhere.  The wine is all Italian and the Italian beer was great! We went at 820 and the place was still packed. Word of advice is to put yourself on their waiting list so that you're guaranteed a seat. Such a gem in North Peoria and break from all the chain restaurants.

10K1HAjVsgXxP8oYssn2pA.text: Loved this place. The environment was very intimate and the food was beyond delicious. People complain about the wait list thing but we had no problem getting in when we wanted too.  Looking forward to our next trip back.

Gid-lPJ4ji9itHNfdkTu5A.text: Once again we requested to be put on the wait list earlier in the day and the timing worked our perfectly. Our table was ready when we were just about 3 minutes away. This a small bustling place with an open kitchen and a great pastry display case. They have a wonderful selection of imported Italian wines and we got one from the Abruzzi region of Italy which was a very good, flavorful red and not too dry. The bread basket of Fabio's wonderful Italian bread is complimentary on the table and is so very good especially dipped in the olive oil and balsamic dressing that is on the table. My husband and I split the caprese salad which had fresh tomatoes and mozzarella cheese and a light topping of olive oil and a balsamic reduction. This time I opted for the bianca parma pizza with prosciutto, arugula and parmesan with a light amount of olive oil. It was so large I took two slices home. My husband had the pounded thin breaded veal chop and it was very tasty. Our friends had the gnocchi and lamb chops and they loved theirs. For dessert we had the Napoleon with it thin crispy layers between sweetened whipped cream so very decadent along with espresso. The espresso here is one of the few places in the valley that knows how to make real authentic Italian espresso. We will return.

5MuDbN8_gcBq-IptP-wQUg.text: This is a legit Italian restaurant- I say legit because the owners are from Italy  The food is homemade and very  flavorful. I had the pear salad, short-rib ravioli (not on menu so must request it) and the tiramisu. Everything was delicious. The space is small so be prepared for a wait. The wait staff was so attentive and courteous. Great experience overall!

KmU7Fy6cKrKjPXj1ZYCgZQ.text: My wife and I decided to go somewhere new and found this place in a whim. We will definitely be back. If you enjoy True Italian food you will not be disappointed. The pizza is great and everything tasted very fresh. We finished our lunch off with one of their amazing desserts and we had to get one to go because it was so good.

wB3HGYPrEyrgrYf5jAkSNA.text: Fabio On Fire has the most delicious Italian food around.  The food is fresh and homemade and they always offer nightly specials.  Just wait until you try their bread, you will want to buy some to bring home.  Besides the food being delicious the staff is always so kind.  If you are trying to find somewhere to eat dinner once you eat here you will be hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

WpwSVLNXl1JeR-al40qyxg.text: Trendy and somewhat chic boutique Italian restaurant for those who like to overpay.  Food is good but certainly not outstanding by any measure.  Very small portions so don't come hungry.  The premeal bread was almost as good as an Olive Garden bread stick.

xMrWRBYJI8e8MWcEOFPtIg.text: Went here just for desert.... best cannolis in the area!!! Plus the inside is very cute.

rNZMm5q9GLkWQJ147T0J-A.text: Our friends recently came here and raved about the food being cooked from scratch, and because of that it was delicious. We just left after our first experience and all I can say is-it was amazing. We are so happy to have a family owned business of this quality so close to our home. Once you walk in the entire staff, including Fabio, make you feel like family and want to feed you like family. You can tell there is great pride in the family history in the business and they don't want to let anyone down. Great food & great people- we will be back.

ZXnoKuxDnOr2uPxLoKD3Yw.text: A great dinning experience. Real Italian atmosphere, music and staff. Service was great, food was great. Recommend making reservations, very popular.

pqLvqmw_APyL_MvU6wh-mw.text: We found this place on a recommendation.  I am so glad we came!  The food is amazing!! We had the margherita pizza, a pear salad, an original cannoli, strawberry cake and a dozen cookies to go!! Everything is AMAZING!! Great flavor, fresh!  The price is suitable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

sSvHxOA-W1lG_tHk7nwCZg.text: Hello peeps went to Fabio on Fire tonight and had Butternut Squash Ravioli , hubby had  the Lasagna. The brick oven pizza smelled and looked heavenly as it paraded on by our table .  Everything tasted delicious but was rated a three because service  was just ok ... waiter was friendly and courteous but appetizers were late , salad came with dinner ,not before , waited for our check and was never offered dessert. I highly suggest you make reservation or log onto  their website and put your name on waiting list it gets packed fast .  As always don't take my word for it . Grab your friends and try it out for yourself ! If you go let me know what you think . Buon Appetito

ds5nzIefBV1_M8wC_ozcIQ.text: New to area and tried out on a weekend. Fantastic food felt like we were back in Italy. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing

J9Wba0w2NWFaabn0OhLFFQ.text: The food was so yummy! I came with a group of ladies eating on the covered patio. I had the butternut squash ravioli and chocolate gelato with meringue cookie. The pasta was great for summer! The chocolate gelato is very rich and chocolatey. The meringue cookie was light and crispy. I would definitely go back!!

a_qt_kFBvAV3h-lWIMU5IQ.text: New Restaurant only open 1 day. Italian restaurant with Authentic Italian food. Met the owners Jenny and Fabio, they were very friendly and made us feel welcomed. This place is sure to be a success. They are from Milan Italy, hence the authenticity. I had the Lasagna and my wife had the fresh gnocchi. We are both Italian and for us to say this next line means a lot. This was the best Italian food we have ever had. The lasagna was a huge portion and I normally eat everything on my plate but I just couldn't. I tried my wife's gnocchi and I couldn't believe how good it was. We are especially blessed because this place is hidden behind the QT and Wells Fargo at 83rd Ave and Lake Pleasant Pkwy, which is close to home. They are open 11-9pm Tuesday thru Thursday and 11 - 10pm on Friday and Saturday and 11-9 on Sundays.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

K1JrgOUf5Vv11nkibPO4uw.text: It would seem like an exaggeration if I said this is the best Italian food I've ever had. Fabio on Fire is no joke. Best Italian food I've ever had. We we're lucky enough to be seated at the bar and the owner served us freshly baked bread.  I will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Veal and beef ravioli and a classic canoli!

6tsdP98e-E0h_2ZmsUWjeA.text: What a great find!! We are visiting from Kansas City and really enjoyed our sausage and broccoli ravioli. Ended with 1 cannoli and then added another so good! Highly recommend

33eZP8MoYlx7G7a0JxaUBw.text: Flavors were awesome. We ended up having a very good pizza and lobster ravioli.  Thought the portions were a little light and the service was just ok.

Eg7HRFAzxewySsvRXhIgwg.text: We just had the best Italian food we have ever had!!! You leave talking about when you are coming back! Service was excellent and you get to watch your food being made from scratch in the open kitchen! It was fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

_snjl2tEMh4UY25MSX7vzQ.text: Their pizza is killer! If you like Cibo, you'll love this! Pastas are homemade and it's also the only place in Arizona that I have had a good cannoli. They are going to need to expand to meet the demands of the area.

O_er45VphEQAlEucKuShQw.text: My husband found this place on Yelp. Amazed we hadn't noticed before, because it's fairly close to home. Anyway, it's really difficult to find a non-corporate restaurant in Peoria, yet here sits this gem! The couple who owns it are from Italy! The recipes are authentic and delicious! I had the butternut squash ravioli. You could tell the noodles were homemade, the sauce was rich and creamy, and the pancetta added a nice savory touch. I want to try other foods there, but I am seriously craving that pasta already! My husband had lobster ravioli, which he said was superb (I don't eat seafood). The kids had a cheese pizza and Kids pasta, and ate every last bite! The bread, pizza dough, and noodles are all house made. They also have a nice dessert menu, which includes Italian cookies!I can't wait to go back! An amazing find in Peoria!

xSfWyCPJWW5DVG7GCFJndQ.text: Team members really go out of their way to provide great service. Food was delicious. Not knowing it was a finer place to eat, we brought our 2 very young children and and may have been underdressed. Regardless, they made us feel welcome and the food was great. Wife had their lamb special and I had the pizza.

vhfgeCddnzP-n9zrQ4C_XQ.text: Real authentic and delicious Italian food! Everyone that works there is so friendly and personable. They  really go above and beyond to make sure you have a great dining experience. So happy we FINALLY have a good Italian restaurant on the west side!

J-ls1T1hrcVGlWr1mRgXtw.text: Just had another fantastic dinner here. Tonight, rack of lamb for me. Lobster ravioli and spaghetti vongole for my friends. Wonderful antipasti board and great wines, by the glass or bottle. Small space, but mighty in terms of value!!

dSf9CmYcdSSYfDCoVaHxDQ.text: Super disappointed in this restaurant, especially with all the great reviews I read prior to making plans here for my mother's birthday. Went on a Saturday night with a party of 6 plus 2 kids and thank goodness we made a reservation. The place is cramped and you are constantly being bumped into by other guests or servers. Our waiter was great and attentive but I didn't like that we were only told the amount our bill was so he could run my card on an iPad and not given an opportunity to actually look at the bill. Sometimes accidents happen and I like to ensure my bill is only what I ordered but I was not able to do that. For our party we paid $150 without tip which is crazy expensive for what we got.  2 of us had the eggplant parm and were both disappointed. It was bland and boring, and I'm missing the "parm" aspect as it has no breading and no cheese. Also for the price, it didn't come with a side of pasta or anything so we simply had a plate of eggplant and sauce.  Another person had a pear salad with lemon vinaigrette dressing that was no more than olive oil on arugula. Also bland and boring.  Another person had the lasagna. Large portion, great tasting homemade noodles but so little sauce it was dry.  The short rib ravioli had meat tasted well done but the cheese sauce was tasty.  One person had the spinach ravioli with a walnut cream sauce and absolutely loved it. The cheese sauce was flavorful and not overwhelmingly heavy.  To end dinner, the tiramisu was outstanding. It'd prob be the only thing worth returning for.

A6bPODEf6gHfkQkUNzPPqQ.text: What a delicious meal!  Fresh pasta, pizza and pastries. Not to mention the bread!  We tried several different dishes and they were all exceptional. So nice to have a neighborhood restaurant that isn't a chain. The service was excellent. Glad to see it was busy even in this scorching heat. Keep up the good work Fabio. Our neighborhood needs you

Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

6NEqCPe7nIeYfQklnhpz-A.text: We peorians are always wanting Scottsdale/Phoenix style quality closer to us - well here it is ... Excellent quality , perfect portions and literally straight outta Italy! Great service from Rafael too - they are clearly excited to be there, excited to have you come and take great pride in their product as they deserve to...it was very hard deciding what to order but at this level I don't think it matters - it was all outstanding... Yes the yelp hours are off - glad we called since they were open when yelp said they were closed... worked out for us since they weren't busy! But that should be fixed ....Can't wait to come back!

xLrm5kEnUH6WHvgvgBCtvw.text: Amazing!!! So happy to have a delicious non chain restaurant on the west side.  What a treat!    We started off with the Burrata - Campari tomatoes+burrata+pesto+extra virgin olive oil.  So so fresh!  Excellent home made bread.   Entre: Gnocchi, Salciccia E. Funghi and Lasagna.  All pastas are home made.   Desserts: Cannoli and Italian Cookies  Be sure to take time to chat with Fabio and hear his story.    Can't wait to go back!!!

fLZw79Wtn3qH_KpNgukRKA.text: Best Italian food I've had since being back from Italy! Good pricing and very friendly staff.  Loved the fresh produce and pizza! I will be making this my go to pizza joint! Thank you Fabio On Fire!!

9n97zmP01VBQKTVS-Pglig.text: Too many negatives.... started off by receiving a dirty knife and a chipped water glass. The same chipped glass was given back later with a tea order. Service was very, very, slow - looked like one waitress for all tables (with a little help from hostess and three bus boys).   I thought the food was OK though others in my party LOVED their dinner. All five others received their orders about 10 minutes before I did (which was taken off the bill). Prices were good.   Just not my kind of place, I guess. Decent food but poor service.

oLj-N3Ihv9eqWQyba3r8Fg.text: Can't wait to go back! This place is the perfect date night , in the neighborhood destination. Everything we had is outstanding & Fabio is absolutely the friendliest, most passionate owner you will meet.

Sci1cbQTkNhfCvrOGrXr2A.text: Wow! Genuine Italian food. Made with love. The butternut squash raviolis were divine. I see that some people complain about the price but you get what you pay for. This is made to order, not reheated food.

hzAyJTxenHK9rdJltNPJ9A.text: Omg !! An Italian Jewel in lake pleasant rd ! Our server Rafael was just incredible , he was just amazing describing the food and the Italian wine - we will be back !!also The owner is working the main kitchen :) kitchen that I am super surprised is very very small - but the food taste is just YUMMY !!! We will be back soon and we will make this place our weekly restaurant - prices are reasonable . For the people that know Italian food - This is the place to go . You will have an incredible experience coming here.

1WfN01Thzst-cBNZZBLrKg.text: The best meal I have ever had on the Westside and I have lived here for 12 years! The homemade butternut squash ravioli with prosciutto and a cream sauce was outstanding. So were the cannolis I brought home. They hope to get their liquor license next week. Hurry in, while you can still get a table!

xLrdc2wN_JpPNhQgTou-aA.text: Overall very good. Limited seating so you have to be patient but everyone is very nice and they clean the tables off fast. We had pizza, bolognese and bruschetta all very good. Prices were good for what you get.

iqpTW4tPDrIAxGKb6C5LkA.text: WOW, this place is awesome! Cheese and meat trays are so good! Breads and pizzas are just like we had in Italy. Everyone and everything is so amazing here! You must go. They also have a nice patio if you would like to sit outside.

cKwVC-Nr1MfEkrPwMRMAdA.text: Simply the best Pizza in the west side!  Fresh ingredients, amazingly friendly service.  This is crispy, True Italian pizza not the generic American pizza sold everywhere else.  Can't wait to try the ravioli on my next visit!

QyG7886lf4r-UhnObnu3Ow.text: This is a really cute place for lunch or dinner. We went for lunch with a big group of 10 and they could accommodate us and everyone was really friendly. I recommend the butternut squash ravioli but i hear the eggplant Parmesan is pretty good. I ordered a couple cookies to go and they were all really tasty. The almond cookie with Nutella was my favorite. Good for big groups but you may need to plan ahead. Parking is easy and the place is easy to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Dessert nom noms
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Inside with the pizza oven

uz08WOILYlBok-2hIWS3-g.text: First time here. Had the capricciosa pizza. Delicious! A little skimpy on the toppings but still memorable. Didn't care for the waiter. Very pushy and made you feel bad for only wanting pizza and not wine, appetizer or desert.

ya2pnjuHIArja2o6WV4XMg.text: Came for dinner. Table reservation at 730. Was sat at 745. Lobster ravioli was ok. Temp was ok. Needed salt. Temperature lukewarm. The desserts ARE AMAZING. Tiramisu will bring me back. Strawberry gelato is so good! Service is ok. Lots of employees. Small place.

KPG69ZTgKh6LRyIqU3sHdQ.text: Oh so sorry to write this review. I have heard only good things about this new addition to the westside so my husband and I were truly looking forward to trying it. Just so disappointing........ Since it was a Saturday night I did use the waitlist app located on their website. It worked very well. Restaurant is an extremely small bistro but cute.  We were greeted by a young gal in ripped beans , which I know is fashionable, but not appropriate for a hostess. We were given menus and as we glanced at them I have to admit it was not the easiest to decipher. I adore Italian food and have been in many Italian restaurant in the valley( and I am truly not including the Olive Garden type)... so although I understood most choices on the menu I watched as tables next to us could not figure out what they were to order. Our waiter was very charming but rushed thru choices and since his lovely Italian accent was very thick , understanding our choices was not made any easier. Again, I watched others at the next table looking inquisitively at him also. Anyways, I made the choices of a glass of Chainti, an antipasto, lasagna with bolognese sauce and a wood fired  pizza with prosciutto -we had heard so much about. We sat back to enjoy our dinner and wham......the place got mobbed.  A basket of three slices of cold bread and small serving of olive oil and balsamic was placed on our table. Everyone seemed to be running around and service went down the drain. Our antipasto, which was a charcuterie board of lovely meats and cheeses was placed on our table by a young man who you could tell really did not want to be working. By this time the three small pieces of bread were gone so we had to ask for bread to put our meats and cheeses on. Although it was very appetizing the atmosphere of people being seated, menus trying to be explained, and no place for those waiting to wait, spoiled the appetizer. We were about a third thru this platter when our lasagna and pizza was brought to the table. Very very poor timing. We sent the entrees back so we could finish our appetizer but feeling rushed asked for a box to take the rest of our antipasto home. The young man who did not want to be there gave us a box.....and then he never brought back the entrees. We flagged down the main waiter and he explained since we sent it back it had to be replated. Sorry- not a good answer. Had to flag down waiter for water, never asked if I wanted another glass of wine  but finally our entrees came. Had to ask for parmesan cheese and red pepper. Hostess brought it.  The pizza as fair. We love wood fired pizza but dough had no taste and toppings " just ok". The lasagne was different...lasagne pasta with bolognese sauce over the top. Sauce was very bland and homemade pasta was mushy. By this time the noise level was so high and since our table was near the door it was so crowded we could not wait to go. We had been looking forward to a cannoli for desert but actually just wanted to leave. Although Fabio was not there the head chef( I think)  did come over and asked how we liked our dinner. We were honest with him. He thanked us for our comments but that was it.  Out $70 ......I really wanted to love this place.........will not be back

E4kRzmQVqrrZYPL1Bm7Mlw.text: Based on the reviews, I expected great things. The food was very good. Compared to the competition you won't be disappointed. Great value. Fantastic desserts! I got the diplomat (Italian for a Napoleon, basically.) Get that if you go.   A four star review for three things:  1. Poor wine list, three choices of red. 2. Uncomfortable, cramped tables very close together. Loud, no sound damping. Bad light, reminded me of lights you'd see in a Mc Donald's. They could do a lot of romancing the place for not very much money. 3. We got a pizza to split for two of us. The center of the crust was soggy.   Those three points aside, I really enjoyed myself. I will go back. Maybe during the day, and sit on the patio.  This is just not the place to go if you want ambiance.  Prices are very fair, and food quality is excellent (save the soggy pizza crust).

AV1XvG0jb08askz_vep3vQ.text: Nice environment and friendly staff. The food was average at best in my opinion for being "authentic". It wasn't bad but not worth the price

9ziO9bYeggpeANkpyF8GeA.text: Authentic Italian food!. A hidden gem of the West Valley.  Highly recommend checking this place out.  They are only open for lunch on select days but a great place for dinner.   Butternut squash ravioli is my favorite by far.

8E4NBiyj421aZxVBYyz6Ww.text: I don't know why this restaurant shows as a food truck. They have a nice little restaurant with indoor and patio seating. It was packed but we did the waitlist so we got right in. And it is delicious! We started with the Burrata which is fire roasted tomatoes with fresh made mozzarella cheese ball, pesto and olive oil. The mozzarella cheese was fantastic!! They serve sliced bread with olive oil and red wine vinegar for dipping which was also delicious. I had the Lobster Ravioli and my husband had the Seafood Pasta Special which included shrimp and muscles. The pasta is made fresh daily and not can you tell!! Everything was so good. They do waitlist seating on the website and I recommend it. It's a small place but the food is ready quickly. Our server Rachel was awesome and we really enjoyed chatting with her. We brought home homemade cannolis and I can't wait to have them!! Great food and great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Lobster Ravioli
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Seafood Pasts
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Burrata

jvNMliEfb0szYC0Nyie5KQ.text: First and foremost I want to say that the meals, service, staff and facility are all exceptional. I had ordered the butternut squash ra  Not sure why this says FOOD TRUCK in the description because the restaurant is certainly not a food truck.   It is small and apparently very busy so they have a virtual wait list process where you can text them to get on the list and they will text you when they are ready for you.   I had ordered ravioli off the menu when I saw a plate go by brimming with seafood. When I asked about it I learned that they had a few off-menu items that could be ordered and that cioppino was what I had seen go by.   Although my ravioli had already beed started they very graciously allowed me to change my order and get the cioppino. It was AMAZING! Wow it really made me happy.   Although we had no trouble getting seats at the bar we have heard that it can be difficult to get in so call ahead and find out about the wait list, but if you like great Italian food do make the effort to get in and try this place. I think that it will make you happy too.

OcZvArYgl8Wb68ly5Pimog.text: This is definitely the best Italian in the valley. Everything was amazing from the pizza to the pasta and the desserts! Oh! Definitely get the tiramisu!!

L4mPJk4cvVlET3DfqM0wqQ.text: So our first impressions were correct. The food was as good as you would expect after walking in the door to the wonderful aromas. Fresh arugula and fresh buffalo mozzarella. Delicious crust on pizza and branzino fish served with perfectly roasted fingering potatoes that are crispy on the outside... and excellently sweet grilled asparagus.  Fish had lots of bones so not a good first date choice.  Service was excellent

The moment you walk in you feel like family and they take care of you like family. From their pizza, to pastas, to dessert, every single bite I took I would say wow. You have to try this place!!

rhFsGGuHwN4DpR3eyjCk0g.text: Absolutely a wonderful experience!! The food was fresh, full of flavor and rich with love. Hands down, one of the best experiences I've ever had. Thank you!!

3wnN-LmmfmPwC9Vy-_5eRA.text: I have no words, and that is saying a lot. We chose to sit at the bar, where we had a front row seat for the kitchen. What an incredible dining experience. We started with the antipasto misto piccolo. The meats were incredible, and the cheese and olive selection a perfect accompaniment. We followed the starter with the branzino and the lamb specials, both of which were delicious.  The wines are reasonably priced, the staff is wonderful. Everyone is friendly, perfectly attentive, and we felt like regulars even though this was our first visit.  This is an independent restaurant on the west side. YOU MUST COME HERE! Help support these independent restaurants. This place is incredible!

J2w7QvRqF0t9x1HPzi8bag.text: Ambience good but a little noisy (especially the patio door which banged every time a server passed through it).  Food was tasty and staff were attentive and competent.  I would have given 5 stars, but the CAPRICCIOSA pizza I had was missing the prosciutto (the prosciutto was the reason I selected that menu item!)  I was told by the staff that it had been made correctly. Duh?  No prosciutto on the prosciutto pizza just seems wrong, so 3-stars.

4acNFTl-m8w64hW4duEtLQ.text: Fab fine in a north Peoria strip mall. I knew this place was legit as soon as we entered when we heard the music and saw the case full of Italian cookies. The space isn't big and fills up fast- full by 5pm on a Saturday. The servers are friendly, greeting guests like family.   - Beet appetizer- Red and yellow roasted beets were tender and sweet, served over a smear of goat cheese and topped with arugula. The arugula actually tasted like real arugula with a nice peppery kick.  - Burrata- a good sized ball topped with a fabulous pesto sauce and served with nice whole roasted tomatoes. Save some of the complimentary bread to enjoy with this. - Pear salad- not super exciting (maybe since it's not really pear season), but loved the arugula and the cheese shaved on top was tasty. - Margherita pizza- this is a True test of a restaurant- crust was perfect, sauce tasty, cheese and basil- just the right amount. With a sprinkle of crushed red pepper, this was really great. - Butternut squash ravioli- omg, these were incredible! We ordered the HH portion which comes with 3 big pieces, stuffed with a sweet squash filling. The cream sauce has a fab sage flavor. We were scraping the plate with the leftover bread.  I know my mom would love this place, so I'm def bringing her next time she's in town. Will be back. Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza- yes!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Butternut squash ravioli, HH portion, yum!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Beet and goat cheese special

Dak34YBsc_4K3LIHqmyKnQ.text: Amazing thin crust wood fired Neapolitan pizza. We had the diavla, sauasage/mushroom and cheese pizza for the kids. Everything was perfect. Owner and staff were super nice and welcoming. Looking forward to future visits.

Q_2YNXTve9IMBs16O7L36w.text: Best Italian food I've had outside of Rome! I have recommended others to go there who loved the food too! Can't wait for the addition to be done as it is a pretty small place right now.

IrkGhjiGraxgBg53S0iOPA.text: This was an authentic Italian meal experience. We had two appetizers, three pizza and three desserts.  Everything was fresh. The pizzas looked so good that we started eating before taking pictures. Everything was exceptional! Highly recommend!!!
