iehawVH0NfnQf8Kn5Ks-kw.text: Delicioso!  Perfect birthday meal. We love the porcheta and pastas! Fabulous wines and great service!

50PMNu8q_gWK7BbJLBZBZQ.text: Exactly that Peoria needs!   In a place full of chains that lack character and,... well ... good food, this place really sets itself apart from the rest.  We ordered 3 dishes and shared... every one was amazing... You could plant this place in the middle of Italy and it would fit right in.  Friendly staff, live music what is not to like?   Highly recommended.

2O9OkBJCClFJ_7Uw6DWGYA.text: Fabio on fire is an absolute gem.  All you foodies out there have got to come to this tiny little wonderful restaurant.  Everything from the pork belly to the Chiopino to the phenomenal Napoleon is just a delight on your tongue a wonderful selection of reds to have with your meal it's just an utter delight allow yourselves at least an hour and a 1/2 to soak in the ambience of an old Italian restaurant in a modern age.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

cUfwCWoAYMf3BW1muW9qwA.text: WOW !!!! If I had to have my last meal on this earth it would be at Fabio On Fire.  My wife and I saw the episode on Plate and Pour last evening and decided to give it a try.  I checked the website and the had a waiting list however we both agreed to make an attempt anyway.  We typically will go to the bar to grab a seat because we love conversing with others at the bar versus seated at a table.  The staff was exceptional , our waiter suggested the Scallops appetizer which we ordered and was nothing short of amazing.  I ordered the Rack of Lamb rare that was roasted in a wood fired oven and my wife ordered the Cioppino, both were incredible, my wife couldn't finish her Cioppino so now I have a midnight snack.  We didn't have room for dessert but we ended up taking a Cannoli and a Napolean to go.  Fabio and the great staff, you have a gem of a restaurant that is the best in the valley.  Thank you, I have already told  friends about this wonderland of Italian delights. Oh if I forgot the bread was to die for.  Fabio on Fire is a must. Thank you Ken & Renee

4aEuAXuIm0ckYoHiL64mPQ.text: Wow the west side finally has a reason to go out for a meal. Love the authenticity and feeling of this restaurant. Very friendly when you walk in, everything is in the open like a True Italian kitchen.  Authentic Italian dishes, pizza, deserts, and beers! Can't wait to have a sit down dinner experience!! Today grabbed a cannoli, pizza, and Birra Moretti = perfecto!   Update: we've had the pleasure of eating in the restaurant several times now and each experience has been great. Everyone is friendly and the staff works well making everything happen in a small cozy intimate setting. Tip: don't want to wait either sit at community table or bar. Fabio himself is fantastic and his staff is a wonderful compliment to what we consider the best Italian cuisine in Arizona. Food recommendations: butternut squash raviolis, any of pizzas crispy, rack of lamb, gelato, and cannolis! Enjoy!!

iorbhqzoQ7fHU7je2lHG_A.text: Unbelievable find, this is a gem. Loved everything we had from Caprese Salad, Lamb Chops, Lobster Ravioli and Tiramisu. Everything is is the best I've had in PHX. They let me try their Bolognese souse, it's a bomb! Franco was the best, get there early, not very big but worth the wait if you have to. The only suggestion I have is to improve on their white wine selection from Italy. Also look at some good, refreshing Roses, not bone dry and a proseco to cleanse your pallet and get prepared for a marvelous meal. HIGHLY Recommend!

4i4t3081P8WFSPhbtVHCjQ.text: Great tasting pizza and bread. Nice salad. Cramped spaces and spotty service. Offered drinks halfway through the meal. They're not prepared for the amount of people looking for a good meal on the north west side. Oven fired pizza so expect to pay more for your pie.

6KskR_uAmjxqbaNYRHw2Ug.text: Wife and I went here due to the yelp reviews. She had the squash ravioli and I just wanted pizza. Food was great employees are GREAT!  Kinda small area but we'll worth the strawberry gelato at the end! Will be back.. now off to a movie!

HNgss12mN-K0LjR4xVxwwA.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars. So let's get the drawback out of the way. We had one of the pizzas and except for the outer crust, the center crust was unable to hold up to the toppings.   But what I could could rave about is everything else. Family owned and run and pride of place is evident in the friendly service of our waiter to the owner checking in with each table to the thoroughness in the wiping of the tables. Having been to Italy, this is THE most authentic experience of a restaurant in Italy that I have experienced in the U.S.   Wine and beer choices are limited which is fine. The flavors of our pizza were far better than expected. We had the Tarantina pizza which was a bit out of our comfort zone for our usual pizza topping choices and the flavors just blended and popped. We were looking for a dinner in the shared pizza price range and were most pleased. Next time we return, my BFF says he will opt for lasagna and I know I shall opt for one of the ravioli specials which are constantly rotating.   We seldom eat dessert, but with the display of cookies, tiramisu and Napoleons along with what our waiter related was the gelato of the day, we had to share a cannoli. Since the best cannoli I've had are found in New York City, I was transported back to Little Italy with the fire bite.   Did I mention the whole restaurant applauding and smiling when a  woman celebrating her birthday was sung Happy Birthday in Italian?  My daughter spent a year in Milan and the first thing I did when we left was text her to say this was a must for an authentic experience.

JOZ2ZxlaWUkaiAXIVPLnLg.text: We have walked in this place three times now to eat and have been treated so rudely all three times that we will not go back. I hear the food is great but the first time we came in (about two weeks after they had opened), we walked in the door (was propped open) and were refused service because they were not opening for 10 more minutes. The second time we arrived, the female hostess was on the phone for about 5 minutes before she looked up. And then, she told us to come back bc they had a big party coming in. And tonight, we waited by the hostess stand for a good 10 minutes before anyone even said hello. I am sad to hear a small neighborhood restaurant is not more concerned about service. I am also not somebody that typically complains and like to give everyone the benefit of the doubt. Sorry...three strikes and you are out!

wCCBOqAlw39Uc-K7prAP1A.text: This place is a gem!  Friends encouraged us to meet them there and we're so glad we did. They import their ingredients and their wine (which was wonderful).  The northern Italian cuisine is so unique and good.  Fabio, the owner, makes two kinds of gelato a week. We had the Meyer Lemon and it was incredible!  The staff is enthusiastic, entertaining and they don't care if you are their table or not...they will take care of you. It's a small venue so get on the waitlist and be ready for a relaxing evening of food and some fun.

DgAxsxRMt1gVu9LLK7Vvvw.text: This place is killer! We used to go to Pomo on 59th Ave. a lot and thought it was the bomb. Fabio's not only replaces Pomo, it's better! Everything's great! We've had pizza, raviola, lasagna, all salads, Bolognese to name a few. All excellent! Oh, and great ciabatta bread. Highly recommend!

am5DUtfB-tW7b-oUKTEH-A.text: Such a cute little place and the food is amazing and authentic! So happy to have a place like this in Peoria! Can't get enough!

5G-bRbkFXNKKF3oiw46Afg.text: I've been here several times and I try to have something different each time. Their pastas are homemade and you can tell.The pizzas are thin crust but the way their cooked makes them taste like deep dish. You must try their desserts! They're fantastic and you can't go wrong.

WZ6SgTqw_XprVmognQqthQ.text: Fantastic!  This is a fabulous find: a delightful, real Italian restaurant.  Fabio and Jenny obviously take great pride in providing excellent food and hospitality.  The staff is very friendly and welcoming, the service great, the food excellent.  Pizze are thin crust, cooked in a wood fired oven as in Italia. The homemade bread loaves wonderful with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The house wines include a sangiovese, a super Tuscan, a chianti, and a primitivo, some of my favorite Italian reds. Being a small place, it gets full early.  There is an online wait list, which is cool.  I just hope that good reviews won't make it harder for me to get back in!

jISU1zZC5OavrrIv09193A.text: This is a PERFECT restaurant!!!  Customer Service: 10 Atmosphere: 10 Attitudes: 10 Food: 10 Prices: 10  We've already visited twice in the last two months...  You HAVE to give this restaurant a try!!!

7xeYGh-nSf8U16NhUuk_0g.text: My husband and I had dinner last night at this little gem.  We were very impressed with the outstanding service and excellent food.  Fabio and all the staff,  assuming they are family,  make you feel like you're eating in their home and are long time friends.  The drink selections were limited as their liquor license is pending.  I had the salciccia e funghi (sausage and mushroom) pizza that was so delish!  My husband had lasagna and said it was the best he's ever had.  I'm not a fan of lasagna but after him saying that,  I had to try it.  He was right,  it was delicious and I will order it next time.  We ordered pistachio and traditional cannolli to go and I ate mine for breakfast!  I'm ready to go back to try the rest of their menu.  I gave them 4 stars only because of the pending liquor license. When I can enjoy a good glass of wine with the excellent food,  I'm sure they won't disappoint.

nT-oxO7bBbEPjD9SI_NMVA.text: Best pizza in AZ and we've had it all, having hit all those top 10 pizza's in AZ lists - it's hands down the best!  The salciccia e funghi pizza was absolutely out of this world!  We also had the gnocchi with bolognese and bruschetta moderna - all were delicious, fresh and fantastic!    We will be back!!  So happy to have this on the west side

hZdjRztXT41P-YG5B6_R1g.text: This place is great! Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and excellent service (Angie is the BEST hostess! and Fabio himself is so friendly). The handmade pasta is perfect and the recipes are very flavorful. Tip - the online menu is limited, so be sure to ask about daily specials. Also, they get busy around 6pm, so either go early, or go to fabioonfire.com and put yourself on the waitlist.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Butternut Squash Ravioli - SO good!  The sweetness of the squash is perfectly countered by the salty pancetta.  Unexpectedly delicious!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Short Rib Ravioli - YUM!  The short rib filling (shredded meat) is tender &amp; delicious, and the creamy sage sauce is perfect.
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Lasagna - better than it looks.  All the meat is on the outside, and there&#39;s very little tomato sauce, but it&#39;s very flavorful.

rr69fxYZULSqeQn_YG6zSg.text: The service and food was incredible. It was surprisingly busy for a Thursday night but it made for great atmosphere!

vHLPIo2iSZ5gcFV9Fzi5Nw.text: So excited we found this place!! We've been so impressed with the food and service we've gone twice in one week. Raffaello was server both times and we were so happy! He's fun and so passionate about the food and our experience. Also their cannolis are the best I've ever had, and I would call myself a cannoli connoisseur!

U23gODCXVu4ay9yNYpvOKg.text: Just amazing! I had the butternut squash ravioli and it was by far the best pasta I've ever had. The service was wonderful. Truly authentic and delicious!

MsFVt307wrGyixF7DsRSsA.text: If you're considering going, DROP EVERYTHING AND GO! This new spot is great! The environment is very clean and drawn together. The atmosphere feels very authentic Italian style. The servers were very friendly and helpful. ALL of their food is made there in the restaurant and the ingredients are all imported from Italy. I ordered the bruschetta moderna and I have to say that it was the best prosciutto I have ever had! We then ordered the Diavola wood-fired pizza. All of the ingredients on the pizza were so fresh and tasty. We finished the lunch off with a chocolate gelato and a cannoli. Both were fantastic! The bar has definitely been raised with this spot. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone! If you want an authentic experience with authentic food, Fabio on Fire is the place to go to!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Diavola wood-fired pizza! The salami on this is amazing!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Moderna. Best Prosciutto I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Delicious Chocolate Gelato and Cannoli.

hXZobauHrrPYGsY3Owo9yg.text: Great west valley restaurant!  Excellent wood fired pizza and homemade pasta.  We usually have to go into Phoenix for high quality pizza and pasta but how we have a local neighborhood joint that is really legit!  The staff were super friendly, like eating at your friend's house.  You definitely have to try this place.

1HZrJX6GKkHDIoQ-cn_juQ.text: What a great experience!!!  Fabulous food, music and service. Been there twice and will continue to return. So nice to have that kind of quality.

SrqrYgk20R6-7qDxD2rXUA.text: Great place, super friendly, and awesome food! We'll be back over and over!!! Be sure to ask about the specials, they always have a good selection of them. Don't skip the pizza. Don't skip the desert either!

8pKqMveM6T972n5s5k7YaA.text: Food was really good, and homemade Italian cookies were so fresh and delicious! They definitely need a bigger place. Only seats 25 or so and there is nowhere to wait.   The owner was very attentive but the inexperience in service brought it down a star. Waiter had to ask if we could sit at the bar and eat. We also had to ask for silverware, napkins and olive oil for the bread.   I really hope this place makes it! I love local, family owned places, especially when the owner is on site and really appreciates your business.

KZAQnpCfqe4z4lofeQVD8w.text: My first time there. First, the staff was exceptional. They knew the menu, the food and the wines. We had a couple appetizers, an entree and desert.   The appetizers were interesting and they were an excellent way to start the meal. Each a very pleasant new experience.   But the scallops were absolutely the most wonderful part of the meal. Cooked to a perfection that I have never experienced before.   Then there was the tiramisu. It was made today by the chef himself. I love tiramisu and this may have been the best ever. The cappuccino that I had with it was perfect.   As I ate I watched several other dishes coming from the kitchen that I must go back and try.   Chef Fabio was interesting to watch and interact with from the very pleasant bar looking into the kitchen. I liked his comment that the food and cooking are his passion making the long days his joy. You can actually see it as he moves about in the kitchen.   I will be back.

zxNUUqBtMI2gQre2dU1VDQ.text: Wow. Just wow.  Incredible food. Incredible service. While I've never been to Italy this certainly felt like an authentic experience.  Great pizza, great butternut squash ravioli, great pork belly. Everything was just awesome.  Can't wait to go back!

5MCW1PKQpP21oVd7HlRKoA.text: I saw this place on TV months ago. My wife and I met over pizza on Wednesdays.  We went. Meat and cheese appetizer was excellent with5 meats, 2 kinds of cheese, quince jam, caponata, tiny olives, and wonderful crusty bread.  We then had the Bianca Parma pizza. (no tomato sauce), but having imported buffalo mozzarella.  Frankly, the amount of cheese was skimpy. However, it was flavorful in total. Our server, from Roma, was very personable and conversation added to our dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Bianca Parma Pizza

Yrp_o8eXMpzojRrK-eZrUg.text: Tried this place last night......   Atmosphere is very delightful.  The patio is great decorated with flowers n low lighting.    Service was terrible.   No refill on water n not even sure who our waiter was.   Had to wave the bus boy down to get an appetizer ordered.   Ordered food from someone else who did know English well enough to communicate to us. Also one of my table guests ordered sausage and broccoli and they were out of broccoli.  No one at my table was raving about the food.  The meatball appetizer was 9 for 5 meatballs and very dry.  One guest wanted wine with her meal and she asked for a recommendation and he said I will get that for you but then came back and said they were out of that.  It was one disappointment after another.    This is a genuine Italian place and they all speak Italian.     I wouldn't come back for the price.  Please try it for yourself and let me know your thoughts.  Maybe I'm not a True Italian but just in my soul.

1b9EXrz33v94jd1PLoK1lw.text: This place is fantastic it's our first time here! My wife heard about this place at work. We just got here and they even called us to let us know that our dinner reservation was running late. The waiter was very polite the owner seems to be checking in on everyone what a great night!

KZDLfzeDQgyOOCSQSqkbPA.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever eaten at! The food was outstanding.   We started with the caprese salad, and let me tell you about the cheese! Just amazing! We ordered the diavola pizza and it was spicy and delicious!   And of course, when in Rome, we ordered a cannoli and tiramisu! The cannoli was heavenly and had a perfect dash of cinnamon. The tiramisu was decadent! Definitely will order again!  The restaurant is so inviting, it feels as if you are in someone's house.

bDAC23WnMfKQea72GT-SYQ.text: Anyone in search of an authentic Italian little gem mustttt come here!!! It's beautiful and the food is beyond our expectations!!! We came here for Mother's Day with friends the place was packed with people waiting outside, good thing we had reservations! Started of with some great appetizers, we tried the mussels, wood fired pizzas (omggggg was it amazing), the waiter was so helpful, recommended great choice of wine and some main dishes! We ordered the Branzino , anyone from the east coast will appreciate a place that has branzino around here. Everything was delicious! The service was great , the owner Fabio is down to earth cool guy, ambience is very authentic, feels very homey and Italian which I love! Definitely something different! Yes I will recommend this place to friends and family!

z00bC7BcEcTx6HlDtlGbfQ.text: Another visit and another satisying taste of authentic Italian Cuisine without having to pay for fine dining prices.  Pizza is always a must because it's got that oven fired taste.  This the first time we are having pasta and it was done to perfection.  We had the Lobster Ravioli, it had the creamy crab sauce overflowing the Lobster filled Ravioli.  Give the Spiedini Di Peace a try, its 6 shrimps lightly breaded and grilled to perfection with a side of Arugula with cherry tomatoes.  Don't leave without having dessert! Many choices but our favorites are the Tiramisu & Diplomatico.  I will try the  Cannoli the next we are there.

ppI8dpCPkXXweklGT_VIPw.text: Is it worth a 2 hour wait... maybe if you're not hangry. Super small busy place. Ordered a salad, bruschetta and the sausage and mushroom pizza for desert the most freaking amazing tiramisu! I hated having to share it. I think I'd stab someone with a fork if I had to share again.. but that's frowned upon so I'll order two next time.   I'd wait again for that desert. The sausage in the pizza was robust with flavor. Thin crust great dough flavor.Yes dough has flavor!   I would like to go back and try the pasta.

40__EuCFhoL3KKRkLAzuLg.text: We have lived close to this place for a few months now and finally tried it after seeing it listed as a top 30 restaurant to try in Peoria. It is much smaller than I thought it would be put that kind of makes it very intimate. Most of the main workers there speak Italian m, which makes sense since the owner is from Italy. The food was pretty good overall. We tried the bruschetta moderna to start off and then had the cheese pizza for my kids and the Bianca Parma pizza. It was all very good.   The mascarpone was really good on the bruschetta. The kids enjoyed the cheese Neapolitan pizza. The Parma pizza was really good. I'm not the biggest fan of prosciutto if it is not more cooked and crispy but I definitely good. We would goo here again for sure. Would love to try their pastas.

ZfkaM9t2ipTVsHx40QCENg.text: YES - YES - YES!  They treated us like family and gave samples conversation while waiting for our dinner.  What a True work of art watching Fabio in the kitchen.  This was our first time and definately going back again, and again.  Thanks to Fabio - his beautiful wife & incredible staff!

HG_xJoM1fG6AAqJqXV3RWw.text: Fabulous authentic Italian restaurant with phenomenal pizza and homemade pastas. Try the ravioli with the walnut sauce. It is to die for! I highly recommend this restaurant!

bh8eRYhz1S_ONJeDFl_QHg.text: Incredible Italian cuisine! My daughter and I sat at the pizza bar and she enjoyed watching the chefs in action. I highly recommend the Italian restaurant. The food was delicious! And their tiramisu was absolutely my favorite!

YVRUyjEoKawU_ngfISPtgA.text: We live down the street but always had trouble getting into this local gem. I figured out you can check in on google, get an estimated wait time and then a text when your table is ready. The hostess actually called and told us when a table would be ready which was about an hour and 15 minutes later. Our waiter was very kind and helpful and explained several items on the menu. The restaurant has its regulars and a sense of community, which I have not seen in Peoria before. We had the pear salad which was very good. The homemade bread that they serve was very good. The pasta bolognese was exquisite. My husband said it was the best pasta dish he's ever had. The bufalina pizza was amazing. You could taste all of the ingredients. We had the tiramisu for dessert. It was so good. Every dish around us looked amazing. I wish I could just take a bite out of everyone's entrees We will def be back to try more things.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Pear salad

YEyAs-GZ_xyngiwWlt_vAg.text: We enjoyed our dinner. Menu is limited & you really need to read Item description to understand what a  rice ball is. Wait staff is very friendly I just learned that our dinner for 3 with 2 appetizers no drinks or dessert was $140.00  We will not revisit this restaurant again

hKEpIdkHFZ2V6UQX82DrMw.text: I had a lovely lazy afternoon with a girlfriend just catching up here. We shared an app, a pizza, and some wine. All were perfect. The server was funny and delightful and was there when we needed him, but not invasive on our catch up session. We weren't rushed out of the place. It was just the right choice for our afternoon needs!

N5JSgCHfcSu6NDHU9Ygq4w.text: After recently returning from a trip to Italy, we were craving some REAL Italian food (*cough* Olive Garden *cough*) and when my brother suggested this was the place to try, we gave it a whirl. What a most pleasant surprise... we stumbled into a True Italian restaurant in north Peoria! (Even the interior reminded us of some of the places we visited)  I want to keep it a secret, so it won't get too crowded... and yet I want everyone to know just how good they are! The pizza was amazingly authentic. The butternut squash ravioli was the favorite of the table! And I haven't had a cannoli that good since Sorrento!!! So much for keepin it a secret... everyone needs a taste of Italy THIS authenticly close to being across the pond!

Vg8Jjrb4RgdjuTPJ19oXcw.text: The food is fantastic.  Their pizza is as authentic as you can get beside traveling to Italy.  The menu changes regularly and I haven't had any dish that I don't like.    The staff and owners are extremely friendly and helpful.  Only "drawback" is because of its own success, the place tends to be quite crowded all the time and the noise level is higher than average than most restaurants.  That might be something to consider if you are planning for a first date, etc...

pCVC5VpvuV8NCKyiyjvniw.text: After much urging from my Italian friends in the west valley, we finally capitulated and gave this place a try.  However, we wanted our visit here to be purposeful and fun. Therefore, we opted to double date and catch up with long time friends who happen to live in North Phoenix.  We were all famished that day, so it was perfect timing for us to connect on a Saturday. We were so thankful that we heeded our friends' advice and made reservations early. This place is small, and gets packed easily.  For appetizers, we shared the Meatballs. It was okay. Nothing special, and the meat was a little bit undercooked. However, since we were so engaged in catching up with our dear friends, we really didn't pay much attention to the mediocre appetizers.  Then came the main courses. Altogether, we had the Spinach Ravioli, Eggplant Parmigiana, and two massive Lasagnas!  I typically order Eggplant Parmigiana as an intro to an Italian restaurant's cooking acumen. Eggplant, if not properly prepared, is often dry or overcooked - sometime even burnt! This one was just right. It was a little heavy on the sauce, and it over saturated the flavor of the eggplant. But, it was good, nonetheless.  My wife's Spinach Ravioli was just mediocre. The Sauce that enveloped the raviolis was delightful. But, the ravioli's internal consistency was quite bland and unappetizing. Surprising for an Italian restaurant.  The Lasagnas were massive in serving, and that was their strong suit. Additionally, the meat inside was splendid. However, the pasta was too pasty as if it was under cooked. And the sauce's lack of flavor and spice was simply underwhelming.  By the time we got our meals, the place was bustling, crowded and loud. There was a point wherein we finally just ended our prolonged catching up, and just agreed to pick another time to continue.  This isn't a bad place. However, it's not stupendous either.

Alhp83iW1_l1Pe2KF_pFWw.text: This place made me fall back in love with Italian after a lot of disappointing restaurants. The butternut squash ravioli was off the charts. I woke up the next morning wanting to go back.

rH4vHk-k2tCEb8FKQZDuVQ.text: I cant say enough good things about this place it is so good such a authentic feel. This tiny place packs a punch

zaOD3fYOU3L2dHidL018pg.text: What a cute little place with authentic atmosphere.  We had the sausage ravioli, butternut squash ravioli, one of the specials with pesto shrimp, lasagna and finished it up with the tiramisu.   Everything was excellent!  Small portions, which is good for not having to cart home leftovers. The dessert was very fresh and everything was flavorful.  We want to come back and try a wood fired pizza.  Molto bene!!

2bU1j0yIAaRcp-_4aKzo0g.text: I could have easily driven by this place without a glance. No fancy building or loud neon sign I would say all the money and attention is in the food this place is GREAT!! The staff was wonderful and the restaurant was clean give this place a try you will not be disappointed. I forgot how much enjoyment you can get from amazing Italian food. Congratulations on a job well done!

k4ruHhSC6oVIzTPgwx3xUA.text: Best Italian food in the state of ARIZONA....! First time here and will be returning. Fabio is a badass and actually is on fire as a chef! Keep it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. On fire!!!!

Rb0lcAx4mjKNmxtWkDNMyA.text: My husband and I had been encouraged to have dinner here and we got in without a reservation. It was fairly early and early summer, but I understand things get busy. The hospitality and service were heartwarming and we loved the food. We had just been to Tuscany and felt as if we were back in Italy. Thank you and we'll be back!

lJLEXIhj4JQWtamIvg8w6Q.text: Ciao, This is the "Hidden Gem", in the NW Valley. I have been to Italy twice in my life and this place has the aroma of "Italia". Fabio, is very much on fire, with his homemade dough, buffalo mozzarella, sausage, all with the ingredients from his homeland. The wine list is of simple value and exceptional, exactly what you would find in Italy.  Pizza here is eaten with a fork and knife just like you would find in Sorrento or ol' Napoli! Dinners are excellent with great flavor and some home made pasta dishes.  Once you are done with your meal, then the next delight are the desserts! Again, all homemade recipes. Cannoli, tiramisu and Italian cookies line this awesome bakery case. Even though you will get a great meal, it is a bonus to walk into a place with an exceptional staff. They treat you like a guest and you feel every bit one, even through their busiest hours! I am sure once you go, it will become a tradition for years to come. Bon Appetite!

oIGSdZLqPfgxEgHHM7G42Q.text: Went here for first time tonight... service was amazing, food was even better. Small place but authentic Italian food well worth the visit !

uAaQcr3-a3wjEk2CeQrtPQ.text: Small place with big hearts! Love the friendly staff, made you feel right at home! The food was delicious !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States

N_8dQd0-5qZlNQpW0jgOMA.text: Im not usually a person who leaves a review for anything unless it was a terrible expierience but I'm compelled to tell you how absolutely amazing this place is. Went for lunch on a saturday, no wait,  and had a pizza for 2, salad, unlimited bread and dessert for under $35. Best pizza crust, woodfired. And Franco was was so pleasant and attentive. I definitely will be back and will tell everyone i know about this place. Italian authenticity at it's finest. Best Italian food Ive found in AZ (definitely competes with the best I've found in Chicago). If your from the midwest you'll definitely appreciate the food and atmosphere. Great job Fabio!

lx-03mA7BZlgVsLf9moYXA.text: So much goodness! Excited to find a great, authentic Italian restaurant on our side of town. Everyone was super friendly. We went pretty early on a weekday, so it wasn't too busy. The waitress took my son over to watch Fabio make and then bake his pizza. He absolutely LOVED this, and the pizza was fantastic (my picky 8 year old ate his entire kid's pizza, then 3 slices of my sausage & mushroom). It's a pretty small place, with an indoor capacity of ~40. The pasta dishes I saw delivered to nearby tables smelled amazing, and the homemade gelato was delicious. Can't wait to try more items from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. I think he liked it (for the record, the crust was very good, but he does not eat crust)

O6hZeZcefqTngxHj1Vzpkg.text: Exactly what Peoria has been missing! This is legit up and down.  Amazing, delicious and authentic Italian. Everything on the menu is sooo good!  Takes me back to Italy. Definitely give it a go!  You won't regret.

mNUnPAFGDtFAoy5hhw73MA.text: A slice of Italy in Peoria, AZ. Delicious, reasonably priced entrees. Amazing pastries and killer tiramisu.You arguably won't find better Italian in the Phoenix metro, especially for the price.   Service is also friendly and fast, and Fabio is a really nice guy.  Congrats to him for opening up such a neat little spot.  A absolute must try for anyone in the area.

rwHnrJNUn03kIGjl_eYYLg.text: Wow I don't even know where to begin. First of all my wife was really excited to try this place as she has seen ton of recommendations on next door for how great it was . I was open since our family was really hoping for a go to place near our house.  Here are my thoughts; the service was Terrible, took 15 minutes to get a glass of water, another seven minutes to order, The menu was really confusing and we felt like the pizza at char was 100x better. Not to me mention the POS system is an iPad.  I get that they have only been open for 7 weeks however I would be shocked if they made 7 months

t7upW8mKUuz2VUTjKpgpCQ.text: Omg what an amazing little gem on the north-west side!  Went with my family after hearing it was a great place from a client.  We got a table on time despite it being pretty busy for a Sunday. Our server came and introduced himself and told us about the restaurant. They have homemade pasta and fresh baked bread and wildfires pizza.   We ordered a burrata and pear salad to start with. The burrata came with roasted Campari tomatoes and pesto. I would have like the tomatoes to have a bit more flavor but the mozzarella was super fresh and with the delicious bread it was a win.  The pear salad was perfect with the spice from the arugula and the sweetness of in season pear.  The toasted shaved almonds were a nice surprise as well. It was dressed perfectly too. Not soggy at al and not too dry.    For my entree I ordered the salciccio and funghi pizza. OMG it was perfection!!!! The sauce was perfectly seasoned. The mushrooms were fresh and the sausage wasn't too overpowering. It was the perfect Neapolitan style pizza. Bubbly, crispy, and chewy at the crust with some char and saucy and thin in the center. The rest of the family all got pastas and everyone's came seasoned perfectly and the pasta was the perfect texture with a nice amount of sauce on top.  We finished with a box of assorted homemade Italian cookies and oh my word they were delicious.   I will definitely be back and would highly recommend this place to everyone!

Uwad8PBCmJ7496XaYrYkFg.text: Husband and I were sick of the same ole same ole in the neighborhood, so we stopped here because it's new. First impression wasn't great. It's a cramped little spot, tables seem like they don't fit right. The teenager that sat us seemed put off by the fact that I didn't want to sit at a tiny table for 2 people (for the record I am a 6' tall female), so we opted for sitting outside. The outdoor patio is nice and it was a lovely evening, so I cooled my jets and felt much less  bitchy. We ordered drinks and were served delicious house made bread with oil and balsamic. Husband ordered a pizza and I ordered the lobster ravioli.  The pizza needed a few more minutes in the oven, but the sauce and toppings were good. The ravioli had a vodka sauce and were so delicious! It took a while to get the food, but we were not in a hurry so it was fine.  We both ordered dessert. Tiramisu and strawberry gelato and both were amazing, but the gelato was the star.

LMCLe3HJYY4ptO4679KVow.text: Was in Fabio's last nite for dinner. Owner and staff were very nice. Had seafood with spaghetti was good. Price was expensive for what we recieved $34.95. Not much seafood. U might want to rethink that 27.95..is pretty average. Wine listed was very limited. We eat out 3+ times a week. NANCY HANSEN 3star

iweXL2aZUdzuzXWQh5odJA.text: This place had great service and the food was really good. Definitely hope they stick around because we love supporting local businesses.

I5h72jXhcKq95kwGfbEwhw.text: Love this place... food and service is always fabulous.. feels like we are in a cute restaurant in Italy

zmYhG7pG0ka0sSPhg95XOQ.text: Went for dinner two previous times only to find the wait times in excess of one hour. Finally I went myself only and was seated immediately at the counter bar while others still had over a one hour wait. First of all this place is way too small for the demand. Sat at the bar with a direct view of Fabio working the wood burning pizza oven, so I was happy.   Ordered a garden salad and lasagna. The garden salad was a very basic salad, a bit under dressed but ok. I'd order another one of their salads when I go again. The lasagna was absolutely outsranding. A huge portion, I only ate half and have a lunch today. It had a boulanese sauce which was meaty, rich and very tasty. The cheese and noodles were perfect. Service was very good as well.  I was able to talk with Fabio a bit and he said he's stunned by the flood of customers. West Peoria is a culinary desert so when a good place opens up, they are instantly successful. I wish other good places underdtood tgat. He also mentioned that even in this location a very short period of time, he's looking to expand. I hope so because I'll be going back and it would be nice not to have an hour wait each time.

WbV4i0UiMrydyoJOUQplhw.text: I am not quite sure where to start! We used Fabio for my sister's bridal shower and from beginning to end--it was just FABULOUS! Jenny was so easy to work with and made getting everything arranged so easy.  The day of the shower, Fabio was such a joy to work with.  Everyone at the party loved him and LOVED the food he made.  We had bruschetta (on amazing fresh bread) and Caesar salad to start and then moved on to some of the best tasting pizzas you can get.  Everything was made to order for all of the guests--fresh ingredients, cooked to perfection, and fast as well!  They were so organized and there was never any long waits.  It was a great flow and great service.  Having Fabio was such a great addition to the shower.  The wood fire oven is beautiful and really added such a neat element to our theme.  I will certainly be using Fabio again and would highly recommend him and his team to anyone!

hkFW-eo5kGFMaMqrPnbNfA.text: We went there a couple of weeks ago & we haven't been able to forget the delicious real Italian food. The bread is gift worthy!! The staff is very friendly & we appreciate being welcomed in to a restaurant. ( some places forget " there are many restaurants to go go.") These people make you feel like family without over doing it.

QhvE0kEKtchRUv0NVbo3sA.text: Food was amazing! Great pizza, friendly staff and Fabio even came to speak us since it was our first time! Will def be back as this is the best authentic Italian I have had in the west valley. I recommend for everyone to check this place out. Call ahead as the seating is limited and get in the wait list. Trust me, it's worth the wait!

6wfRxw2AloayXUwCEqxcbQ.text: Read some reviews for Fabio On Fire and they where some 4's and mostly 5's, so I had to give it a try. I moved to Arizona three years ago and while I'm still happy with my decision, there are a few things about New York City that I miss and a good Italian restaurant is one of them. Fabio seems to have some growing pains that they will no doubt resolve but the most important reason to go is the food and they have that well conceived and well executed. The menu is small, but there's something for everyone and the specials were so enticing that all three of us went for the special, while saying we'd be back to order some of the menu items that caught our eye. Fabio will see us again  in the near future.

csCMwvQPP_aG-Jab_0zmUA.text: Amazing food, everything from the fresh capresse salad to the Neapolitan dessert! The pizza crust was perfectly wood fired with toppings that made it hard to stop eating. My dad had the lasagna and said it was the best he's ever had! Highly recommend to people who live near and far!

lg4yMeuk9V0UebsSbkpO4Q.text: Today, 9 of my friends and I had lunch at Fabio's fabulous restaurant! Most people who know me, know that I am a big supporter of locally owned restaurants, so when I heard about Fabio opening a restaurant in Peoria, I knew we had to try it! It was fabulous! First, the bread is the best I have eaten. Fresh with a crunchy crust that had a good chew to it, as well. The inside, soft, yet substantial. I am pretty sure I ate half a loaf. I ordered the Tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce. Excellent! Homemade pasta and sauce. I didn't order a salad, but the ones that people ordered looked delicious and were very generous in size.  The pizzas are wood fired in the oven, which is the prominent feature of the restaurant interior. Everyone raved about their pizzas. After the meal we had gelato and several of the desserts to pass around. The gelato is house made and so creamy and good. The different pastries sampled, were outstanding.  I plan to make this one of my regular places to dine. The inside is well appointed and it is perfect for a date night or lunch/dinner with friends.

spofgxKBkNty4Y-GOUFifw.text: Fabio on Fire was our late night treat for our wedding, and everyone LOVED his pizza. Not only was the pizza amazing, but Fabio and his staff were so sweet. Fabio actually gave me and my mom hand written cards to congratulate us, which I thought was such a nice gesture. I feel bad because our guests ate all 40 pizzas we had ordered in less than an hour, and I was kind of rude to Fabio when they said "no more" (because I hadn't gotten any yet). We finally decided to just pay for more pizzas...and they were more than happy to make them. Giving me more pizza is the easiest way to make me happy ;-)   Anyway, just wanted to say thanks so much for making my wedding night so special, Fabio!!! Everyone loved you and your pizza! :-)

1B1TfBtL3b2OX7xhvlVlew.text: This is the most authentic Italian food i have ever tasted. The service was great as well. Amazing spinach ravioli, it was perfection. For the first date, try a delicioso desert. Tiramisu is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Fabio On Fire - Peoria, AZ, United States. Delicious tiramisu

eFb0KqnAZP_boppkaAnyJw.text: Ordered several to go meals as well as anti pasta and two different  salads. The gnocchi was the BEST as was the lasagne. Grandma liked her bolganese pasta.  The Bread and the dessert were like heaven!!  WOW just WOW

J1UdH9x8PIc5JRlm_Mb3Hw.text: We family style ordered almost the entire menu. I challenge you to find one item on this menu that is not blow your mind incredible.

wOD13ySOktNXg1bhbSwXmA.text: Amazing restaurant! The pizza was delicious. They were very friendly and accommodating to our little kids. We brought a cannoli home for later since we were so full from the pizza. Can't wait to go back and try the pasta.

hOxpv3hKZS7A7LhN6s62iA.text: This new Italian bistro is a neighborhood gem!   We were greeted by the owner Fabio, and promptly seated.  Our waitress then greeted us and took our beverage order.  She returned with beverages and pieces of scrumptious Italian ciabatta bread, fresh from the oven.  OMG, amazing!  Luckily, they sell loaves of this bread.  We ordered pizzas which were hand-crafted and baked in a stone oven. They were delicious.  We ended our meal with cappuccino and HOME-MADE gelato.  The strawberry gelato had fresh strawberries in it, and the lemon had a bright tartness to it.  This is the closest we've found to the flavors of gelato we experienced in Italy. So happy to have this new independently owned restaurant in Peoria!

qrT6-VOyiJiaDdLIAS4cCA.text: Brought some friends here to have the same great experience we had when this first opened and this was the WORST service we have had! First,  the server told us his life story before even asking what we would like to drink. Then things went downhill from there,  took forever to get utensils,  we didn't get serving plates until halfway through dinner, never got the serving spoons we had to ask for, and server never came back until bill came and he gave us the wrong bill. Overall,  great food,  HORRIBLE service.

Pv8NIi80zmjnvCWiKjzX7w.text: This new spot is excellent! I lived in Italy 5 years and the pizza takes exactly like it did in Italia. The service was great and the desert were ridiculous!!! Gelato is made fresh daily and pastries were all very good. If you want a taste of Italy and can make the trip, this is the place!

Ou53d16Uba_6I4eKOu5eAw.text: The food is great, but the menu is very limited. It's a very authentic little neighborhood place.. if you want to have dinner on the weekend, get there early, I don't think it holds 10 tables and it's very popular.

pZ0dffblsKoUVJqcaKT5fA.text: Super stoked that Fabio finally has a brick and mortar location! Great pizza made right in front of you in the wood fired oven. Worth a drive regardless of where you are, but we are loving that it happens to be right in our neighborhood. Gluten Free Pizza options too for those in the need.

btLLnUrf5MQFS7kYzfvXTg.text: Went on Friday night.  Been looking for a great restaurant in the area. But this wasn't it. I ordered a ravioli for $16.95. It was better than some in the area but not what I expect for that price. Everything looked ala carte so for only 7 raviolis ( no salad or anything). $17 is high.  I left hungry. Shared a tiramisu which was excellent and worth the $7.95.  Both my friend and I were a bit disappointed.  Perhaps if they included some greens on the plate the price wouldn't appear so high. Unlikely to return

DYaDPn2rEhJVkJEzxu-cLQ.text: Five stars and I'd give it 6 if I could. Fine dining food and experience. My wife and I gave this place a try on a recommendation from a friend. We sat at the bar as it was very busy. We wouldn't normally sit at the bar but as it turns out they were great seats we got a little extra bonuses for sitting there!  All the staff were engaging and friendly. They treat everyone as family. You will fall in love with this place on your first visit. Now to the best part, the food. We had lasagne and lobster ravioli. Both we're outstanding we enjoyed them completely. Nice portion sizes quality food and a wonderful ambience!! Give it a try!

VcFaXg3b_VRlc_VpQIF8WQ.text: We had a fabulous lunch! The Veal Ravioi was delicious and brought to our table by "Grandma," who was so PROUD of her dish- I felt the love she has when she makes it!  The pizza was very good.  Tirimisu was excellent!  Take home some of the cookies.  Best of all, Fabio greets you when you arrive, and talks to every patron at least 3 times and gives a handshake as we left!

bfT5nB-kTTFycCGhpZ4ieQ.text: My husband and I had dinner here and enjoyed the best meal we have ever had! It is so nice to have a restaurant in the area, that actually serves amazing food! We had Placido Chianti, bruschetta, lasagna, braised short-rib ravioli and tiramisu. We ate and drank EVERYTHING. HIGHLY recommend this place

S06u-FkXIn5bRgqMl37OYw.text: First time tonight, great service great food.  The owner Fabio is a great humble host.  Glad to have this in the neighborhood.

SkEFrbxQReTefIcdy9i2bQ.text: Came back to Fabio to dine in and try some other dishes.  It was Saturday night and packed to the gills.  The place is so small it doesn't take very much to fill it up.   We were sat on the patio with an older gentleman as our waiter.  He was extremely slow.  He moved slow and talked slow and stopped to chat at every table.    We were getting ready to leave and a younger man brought us some bread.  We ate the bread and still were waiting for the waiter.  Our glasses of water were empty and never refilled.    Once again ready to leave the waiter finally comes by.  Nice enough fellow but the sense of urgency as a 140 year old 3 legged turtle.  We ordered our food and begin to wait again.  Food finally comes out.  The pizza was amazing.  Great crust, perfectly balanced, fresh ingredients, slightly burnt.  Highly recommend the diavola.  The lobster raviolis were terrible.  The flavor was bland, the lobster was fishy.  Just bad all around.  The salad we ordered was basically arugula with some olive oil and a quarter of a pear sliced up.  This isn't a salad this is the base of a salad.  Where is the rest??  The owner came out to our table and was extremely friendly and nice.  I really wish him well.  He'd be better off putting this waiter as the host and getting someone else in there for starters.  Our bill came out to $80+.  No where near worth that.  I would only come back at this point to order pizzas to go.

v67Tk-M2ugstpMKtLSE0kw.text: Great place!!! Food was wonderful!!! Would like to try the pizza next time! Appetizer was great!!! Recommend this place! Would love to see the restaurant expand their seating area -- they need more room in there.

WKldtBglq-5wS5Z8WDAHZw.text: Outstanding food, personalized service efficient and friendly. Had the seafood special just below perfection, two pasta dishes were outstanding, hugely flavorful sauces and perfect handmade fresh 'al dente' pasta. Salads were good but not a strength. Fresh bread and gelato both made on site completed a trip to Northern Italy found in Peoria. A place to take family and friends

2iaHdvaDnUFOg3IAv4V4rw.text: There's no doubt that Fabio on Fire creates dishes that are outstanding AND unusually sophisticated for casual Italian dining.   There is a wide variety of authentic pizzas -- and even one "American style" pizza. All are fabulous, and if you let your taste-bud-desire be your guide you won't be disappointed.  But the best dishes are not the pizzas -- but the pastas. On my last visit I had the short rib ravioli, and others at my table had lobster ravioli. The handmade pasta was cooked to perfection and the seasoning was spot on.  The house red wine is a notch or two above the normal as well.  The servers are congenial, mostly Italian, and food lovers themselves...and their passion for the food they serve is evident in everything they do.  Bravo! Brava!

XQB3ntxBKEInQanN7tmfyQ.text: This place is a little hidden gem on the west side! We came here for the first time with my in-laws. The staff is super friendly and very accommodating! We had a great server. He explained everything from the appetizer specials to the dinner specials. We got a bottle of wine, it was good wine! The only thing that I didn't like was the amount of money that we paid for and it was a twist off top. Seemed kind of cheap. The food was all excellent! We got two pizzas, A margarita and one that came with balsamic, arugula and Parmesan on top. It was missing the balsamic vinegar at. But it was still great! My in-laws really enjoyed their margarita pizza as well! My husband and I also split the special of spinach ravioli with a creamy walnut sauce. It was the best ravioli I've ever had! Very different but so good! I can't wait to go back and get it. Make sure you have enough time in your evening when you come here, it's not a quick meal.

sMeRKzNFrrn9ALqLdwDUIQ.text: My absolute favorite Italian!!   Just scrumptious and I usually order the butternut squash ravioli!  Last Friday I ordered the lamb chops  so delish!!  Love Fabio

r1yTiob9xnNGeXElQcDq-g.text: Very nice place with a great menu. I had a special seafood pasta. Wife had lasagna. We tried some of the deserts. Everything was fresh and flavor excellent. Plenty to choose from on the menu. Highly recommend.

uz6bYisllLAFdZA-MdX-ng.text: Loved this place! First time coming by after looking at the reviews and we were very pleased with it! All of the staff was so friendly and talkative, made it so much more welcoming! It's like being in little Italy, the place has such a good vibe. We ordered a pizza which was delicious! Before leaving, we got a dozen of the homemade cookies and they were great! We'll definitely be back!!

CyXhXB1wZYb183Obd1Tviw.text: This place is INCREDIBLE!! The best Italian food I've ever had in AZ! It may be the best Italian I've EVER had (and I grew up back East). I went with my family and even the kids loved it. The service is impeccable. Very attentive and took the time to thoroughly explain the menu and specials and to answer any questions. The atmosphere is warm and friendly.  The food... oh the food! I got a special they had that night. Spinach and ricotta Ravioli with a creamy walnut sauce which was unique, rich, and delicious. The pasta is so tender and fresh! It's clear that lots of love and care goes in to everything. I also tasted the Butternut squash ravioli, which is their specialty, and it was so flavorful I kept taking little tastes of the sage sauce because I could not figure out how they could pack so much flavor into it.  Overall there is truly not one negative thing to say about this place. I Do not give 5 stars lightly but this place deserves every one of them!

Bmw83RF04bjKhkTdZjxp1g.text: Fabio On Fire recently opened a brick and mortar location in Peoria AZ. This company is already established and well known as a mobile catering company and also participates in festivals and farmer's markets in metro Phoenix serving up Italian Baked Goods and Neapolitan Style Pizzas.  The New brick and mortar Restaurant offers appetizers, mostly authentic style Neapolitan Style Pizzas, House Made Pastas, Amazing looking Baked Goods and House Made Gelato.  We tried the Diavola and the Marinara Pizzas. The Pizzas are for sure high quality. The crust is thin and was blistered and charred but not burnt. The crust had a great flavor and chew but it was typical of the Neapolitan Style and had a wet but not too wet center. The Diavoli was topped with a high quality hard to come by spicy salami and the Marinara was topped with wildly flavorful sauce that was also very garlicky.  The pizzas are light and thin and don't weigh you down like the way most pizza does.  Thanks to my husband who helped me with a couple slices we got to try some house made gelato. We tried the chocolate and the strawberry. The chocolate taste like the Italian Chocolate Bar my in-laws just brought back from Italy. It might be slightly an inquired taste........The strawberry gelato might have been the BEST or was one of the BEST Gelato I've ever tried anywhere! It truly was pure bliss.   The dining room is casual and nice and is in full view of the open kitchen and dessert case. It looks like they might offer patio seating in the future.  I saw a liquor license application in the window but at the time of my visit they only offer water and mostly Italian beverages.  Service was off the charts amazing we were greeted by Fiorello Herself from Fiorello's Ristorante. It was so nice seeing her again.  This place is already a ************GEM of Peoria! *****************  Already *************Among the best pizzas of the west side!*************  House Made Pastas! ******Baked Goods!******Amazing Strawberry Gelato!********

JArvJUF9GtsQkozjm0v3gg.text: This is a super solid spot in the west Valley. I had the privilege of trying his pizza when he catered an event I was at and was really excited to see that he had opened a restaurant. Their bolognese and homemade accompanying pasta is top notch. The meatballs are second to none. They had about a bazillion different types of filled raviolis and will definitely try one of those next time. It's a small spot and I hope he has lots of success. The prices are incredibly reasonable (a shared app, a shared salad, two entrees, a scoop of homemade gelato, a dozen Italian cookies to go AND a bottle of wine came in at $100 before tip). Go!

CRbuN5CZ9R5pX3J-H7dWug.text: Worst pizza ever don't waste your time or money here First time eating his pizza and the dough wasn't cooked and the cooks answer was it's Italian pizza so it is meant to waste like that

My9QpTMkgwYm8TeTDkyZ0A.text: This place has great Italian food. The wait staff speak Italian to one another. The eggplant was delicious. The pizza is amazing thin crust and yummy. The buffalo mozzarella appetizer is totally worth it. We bought dozens of cookies and biscotti. You need to try this place!

bALBWRkFZSVGrhYFVBeVfA.text: Let me start by saying I never really understood the idea of "al dente" or the "The pasta is not swimming in sauce" comments you would hear all those cooking shows say.   Having eaten pasta for longer than I care to admit,  I feel as though I've been cheated by the restaurants serving the noodles and goop I have been eating. Now on to the review...  My wife and I went on the advice of friends that recently returned from a three week stay in Italy.  They said that if I wanted real authentic Italian food, then Fabio's is the place for us. So, we went and had buffalo mozzarella and prosciutto salad, spaghetti w/mussels and shrimp, short rib ravioli, and strawberry gelato.    The cheese and prosciutto were delicious. The pasta was the best I have ever EVER had. I totally get the al dente now. The sauces coated the pasta as opposed to a ladle of red stuff with meat slopped in the middle of flavorless noodles.  So I guess those TV chefs knew all along what pasta is supposed to be, huh?  The strawberry gelato was also perfecto. The kind of OMG I need to sit down before I pass out kind of good.  Yes, it's a tad pricy, and yes it's True that you don't get endless plates of dreck to gorge on, BUT you will get the best tasting meal you may have ever had. No, I don't say that lightly. It really was that good and I plan on going again tomorrow.    As far as service goes, everyone was super friendly. Fabio came by to introduce himself before the food was even served. Rafael knew every detail of what you were going to eat, and we chatted like old friends about his family.  I had the good fortune of living in Europe while stationed in Germany. The "service" was just as I remembered.  No, they don't hover over you and hand you your check before you swallow that last bite. Rather, they treated us like guests. That's how it's done over there.  It's slightly slow by American standards, but I didn't want American-Italian, I wanted Italian-Italian and that is exactly what they gave us. The portion size was also perfect. While the food was so good I wanted to eat more and more and even more; I was full but not painfully so. The bang for your buck IS there in quality not necessarily quantity.  I'm perfectly fine with that.

tvgO7llgkj4wRJpKK5_8Hw.text: A great little (just 64 chairs) spot.  No reservations but you can put your name in and go across the street to a micro brew-pub and the restaurant will call you.  Everything seems to be made on premise...pastas, breads, sauces, etc.  The menu is new and they've added some items.  Pizzas are outstanding.  Coal/wood fired oven.  Hand thrown.  But ask for the specials.  They are phenominal !!!  d

JNPCRp6KdAQ7FEP-8qzEAw.text: Oh my goodness !!!  What a wonderful and DELICIOUS little place !!! Our friends kept telling us we needed to try it and are we EVER glad that we did !!! This was a dining experience that is rare and memorable with the warmest and most sincere owner and staff.... it felt like you were treasured family sitting down to feast.  We have found a new little jewel that we cannot wait to try again

Lv4ydfEtt3yHXmyn6ahy6A.text: This place is simply amazing. It's a beautiful little eatery sort of tucked away. The patio is beautiful tonight and the food was absolutely spectacular. I had the braised short rib ravioli in a buttercream sage sauce. It was rich, but not too rich, and SO full of flavor. My son had a pizza. The crust was one of the best I've ever tasted. Everything is freshly made and you can see the herbs growing in planters on the patio. For dessert we had a cannoli and the Napoleon. The Napoleon pastry was so incredibly flakey and the Chantilly cream was light and smooth. The cannoli pastry had the perfect snap and just the right amount of cinnamon.  Most of the crew speaks Italian and they are incredibly friendly. The way they speak of the food is as if it's made of magic. The owner/chef is Italian and his recipes have been passed through the generations; their pictures are on the walls. Call ahead to have your name placed on the list, but walkups are welcome too. It's not very big and it does get busy quickly. This is a WONDERFUL date night spot and they do have a limited kids menu as well. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this establishment.

wjMQ8Bdzrd9izjy0Cv1zSg.text: So glad he opened a brick n mortar! I've followed his mobile pizza business 2-3 year ago and it was very good! Pizza is excellent here. 2nd time here this time to try the dinners. Started with the Caprese appetizer, very good mozzarella and tomatoes. My wife had the Eggplant parm which was a special, a bit on the tough side as if they didn't slice it thin enough. I had the Short rib ravioli... homemade Ravioli but the short rib was missing flavor and for $23 i was disappointed! For dessert it was the Cannoli! Very good! We will be back as this is what the Upper West Side needs

Hi8sEvh6V7utafG3E_RdIQ.text: Everything I've had here is amazing. Best butternut squash ravioli I've ever tasted. Pizza is delicious too. Thanks for being on the West side!

2r_ocnHUEqNmN4w0392z1w.text: What a hidden gem!!! I just moved here from austin, tx and living there I had amazing food around me. Well, moving to the west valley has been a bit of a culinary shock for me (a restaurant manager) and my boyfriend (a Chef). WOW!  Our experience tonight at Fabio on Fire was amazing, from the food to the service (Raphael). We had an amazing time. Trust me, I'm no yelper, because yelp is the death of restaurants and everyone on here thinks they are the next food network critic. But man, holy sh*t, this place has everything you want in a restaurant. We are so excited to live across the street and have our new go to spot.

-i5yeMfgqbZ0VkJeOPm7UA.text: I have been fortunate to dine around the world.  Yet, I do not believe I have ever been privy to such a wonderful family experience.  Now, when I say family, please understand I am not in reference to the customer...no, it is how Fabio and his staff adds you to his family, once you walk in the door.  Yes the food is amazing, as stated, yet it's the staff that makes you feel like you are in Milan, or Florence, or even a cafe in Sorrento.  Leave the chain Italian restaurant alone tonight, they excel and serve their purpose of quantity. Stop by Fabio's for the warmth of a quality family adventure.

DdamFKeQZOedDmqUdlFrww.text: Excellent food! Patio is nice but on the small side. The whole place could use expansion. In our party of four everything we ordered was great and the desserts are to die for!

f6nM6wZEmEFGbw7sXvIq0w.text: Love this place. The service is good and the food is wonderfully authentic. Makes me miss Italy that much more!

N0eTj_0VBMSUHKXeB9_8xw.text: OMG SO GOOD!!! Make sure to go early or an off day super busy. It's expensive but well worth it. I can't wait to go back.

m3wjmsPW26J_rCobzERJMQ.text: One of the best holes in the wall in the upper northwest valley.  I've been here at least 5 times since they opened and it's been fantastic every time.    Great food, great service.  The servers make you feel like you are eating at home with family.  The butternut squash ravioli is on point! Can't imagine a better ravioli dish anywhere. The pizza is really good and easily competes with the best wood fired places in the valley.  They have frequent special dishes including appetizers that aren't on the menu.  Don't forget to ask about them.    This gem of a restaurant is located on the end of a strip mall. Yes it's small, yes the tables are tight.  Who cares?  Meet the people you sit next to and enjoy your time there.

apyg3rO_3zSTzgIwo__rUA.text: We were given this place high praise and we were hopeful that finally a good non-chain type restaurant was on the west side.  Disappointment was slow in coming. First we were seated on the side patio near a very large, noisy party and decided against moving.   Then, not familiar with Italian wines, we asked the waiter for suggestions; he, of course recommended the most expensive.   My wife enjoyed that small but $14 glass while i had an Italian beer to keep the mood going.    We decided to order a pizza, but saw that they were $17 and up for 12 inch individual pizzas.  We ordered two salads with our pizza and ended taking some home.  The salads were great, i had mixed green and my wife had the pear after mistakenly receiving the strawberry.  The pizza finally arrived and it was soggy.  Overlooking that the, crust was very good, in the style of Bianca's in Phoenix.  They do have a high-end oven.  We skipped dessert and ended up over $60 with an udeserved tip of 15% paid while the waiter hovered over us telling us to pick either 15, 20, 25 percent tip.   All in all, I have concluded that the experience would have been one and a half stars better having a waiter without the attitude.   Well, we intend to continue our search for a west side Italian eatery.

Cda0itjydvgOaXeU7W1odQ.text: This is place is a hidden gem! I had such a happy and wonderful dining experience here. Food was behind my expectation. The lobster and crab ravioli is like magic cure for any moody days. I have never felt so happy after a meal.  The owner and staff were incredibly friendly and genuinely want the customer to enjoy their food. Definitely will come back again!

m4QZKg9P5oFtDo319Zli-g.text: Tonight I got to enjoy an AMAZING dinner with some dear friends at a new place that felt like home... Fabio On Fire... I was transported back in time to enjoying my Italian heritage with good friends, amazing food, the perfect and small ambience and so much more. If you get the chance to check out Fabio On Fire, make sure you say hello to the owner Fabio and be sure to have Rafael take good care of you! Absolutely amazing! We will be back!!! A piece of Italy in Peoria! Molto Bene!  Use the online waitlist on their website, as it is small and there will be a longer wait if you don't use it.   Bruschetta Moderna, Ravioli Specials, and Tiramisu were just some of the items we had that I will be back for!

Iq_kDxDpc9Y1TeJaGPuIrg.text: Amazing Italian restaurant!! By far the best Italian food I've had in Arizona! Appetizer, pizza, pasta...all delicious! Fresh bread...delicious! Cannolis...amazing! Go try it!

3Q5nn0G3iDEM8xeIHUajJw.text: Being a vegetarian, the menu was limited.  I had asked if they would custom make me a dish, and after going back and forth, they agreed.  I did not like being told - Fabio doesn't make custom dishes, or to eat the Butternut Squash Ravioli on the menu by the waiter.  If I wanted the ravioli I would have ordered it.  I must say that the pasta dish they made was bland, and I had to add salt and hot pepper to give it some taste.  Not impressed at all with the food, and found the prices to be high for what we were given.

g8ox6WUM-gbrkBFqf6NjDg.text: Excellent service,  really good food.    We went for dinner the other night and we were greeted with hugs and kisses.  Well, I wasn't but the two who brought us here for dinner were.  My boyfriend's sister and brother-in-law have known the owner and head waiter for a long time and have followed them from one resturant to this one.   The service was amazing.  The wait for food was a bit too long and i could tell others near us were getting a little impatient with their wait as well.  However, the owner came out and went from table to table and made quick friends.  He knows customer service for sure.   The portion sizes seemed a bit off to me.  I had a very large portion size of spaghetti while my boyfriend, who ordered the entree of ravioli, got a much smaller portion. The tortellini portion size seemed a bit small too.  The resturant size is super small and the wait for a table could take a long time, but in my opinion the wait is worth it.

C-DFDGnvYIqFK18YKLqU9Q.text: Amazing!! Every bite is an absolute treat! Such an intimate and authentic Italian experience.  Everyone is so friendly and we loved watching the chef prepare everyone's dishes with such pride and precision. This is the way Italian should taste - every ingredient works so well together and you can taste every layer.  We had braised beef ravioli in a sage butter cream sauce,  bolognese, tiramisu & Diplomatico for dessert and started with the most beautiful Bufala Burrata wrapped in prosciutto like a flower! Chef Fabio interacts with everyone to be sure you're happy.  You have to go!

07N46gxYa3CIvNr1Rwv1bQ.text: The saving grace of this restaurant was the food. My wife and I rarely get the opportunity to go out and dine with our two kids because of my unique work hours. Tonight we finally had an opportunity and I chose Fabio on Fire because of the great reviews. The waitlist feature worked very well, so I should compliment the restaurant on having such a fantastic time saving feature implemented. We were presented with waters and a bread basket along with olive oil and a drop of balsamic. We were then asked by the server assistant who dropped them off"Do you guys really want balsamic?", in an inconvenienced type of tone. I said yes please. " Oh, ok, I'm going to have to grab some then. I ran out when I was making the plate" was the response. His tone continued to suggest that it was a major inconvenience and I didn't understand why he was speaking in such a matter. Ten minutes went by before we had our very first brief interaction with our server. He asked if we wanted anything else to drink and if we decided on what we were having? I said that we decided on an appetizer to begin with. He proceeded to say ok and suggested a seafood appetizer as he walked away to another table. He clearly didn't hear what I said or pay any attention which became the reoccurring theme of the night. He came back five minutes later and asked if we were ready in a very rushed and pushy matter. I said that we would like to start off with the imported cheese as an appetizer and that my wife would like the Valpolicella and I would like to have the Barbera d'Alba. He said ok, so two reds. I said yes, and repeated the names of the wines. My wife then ordered her main dish and then I ordered mine. He then proceeded to say the infamous two reds quote that he was fond of. I said yes please and repeated the names of the wines for the third time. You could tell that he wanted to get through the order as quickly as possible and was not listening. I felt at that point that he was going to make the wine decision for me. For work, I sell imported wines to restaurants with Italian wines being a very robust section of my portfolio. I'm well versed in them and understand them very well and I know what I would like with my dining experience. This was our last interaction with our waiter until the end. The wine was served to us by another individual and I knew that it was incorrect and I felt that we were given what he thought we should have. Maybe he had to achieve a certain amount of wine sold for a particular bottle and took it upon himself to charge that one instead. I'm just assuming of course. I would have asked the waiter If he would have come back to the table at any point in time. He visited other tables around us very frequently but didn't want to come near us. Could it have been that he assumed a couple with two kids wouldn't tip well so why try? Once again I'm assuming. It truly felt like we were not nearly as important as any of his other tables. We did receive water refills and a bread basket refill upon asking other employees. That was after sitting with an empty water glass and bread basket for a long period of time. As a patron of a restaurant that charges the amount of money that they do, I should not have to continuously ask for things. My needs should be anticipated through constant check backs at the table to make sure that I'm having an enjoyable experience. That's how you find out about any problems and fix them in a timely matter. After we finished our main courses, another employee cleared our plates and asked if we would like dessert. I declined because both my wife and I wanted to get out of the restaurant as quickly as possible at this point. He then asked who our waiter was. I replied saying that I'm not sure, and that his guess was as good as ours. We hadn't seen him at the table since he took our order. The employee smiled and walked away. Our waiter came out a few minutes later with his tablet and presented me with the bill via the tablet screen. My suspicion was right about the wines and I noticed that he gave me a different wine then what I ordered. I have him my card and he forcibly placed the square card reading unit on the table. I bit my tongue because I had promised my wife that I would not make a scene because she wanted to leave as soon as possible. I proceeded to tip 10% while he hovered over my shoulder ,which is extremely low to me. I did it in hopes that he tipped out all the other individuals who were actually doing his job at our table for the evening. We felt extremely unwanted in what seemed to be a very welcoming establishment to all others around us. What should have been a great experience that my family could have enjoyed turned into remorse for even making the attempt to go out.

r1ivT-Kgihnyn37zS96Gtw.text: What a hidden gem! We stumbled across this place after visiting a neighboring brewery (also amazing). We were greeted by our waiter right away...and I love his Italian accent. We each had a glass of wine and started with the mozzarella and prosciutto. Wow! I've never had mozzarella be so tasty (imported in from Naples!). Then we enjoyed the evening's specials which included short rib raviolis and the lobster ravioli (sooo good). The sauce tastes like REAL sauce...fresh and flavorful. Then we indulged in dessert. I'm a bit of a cannoli snob but one bite in and I knew it was made right. So good, as was the tiramisu. In fact, it was so delicious we brought home 2 dozen cookies too (couldn't resist).  I've been to many high dollar fancy Italian restaurants across the county and THIS place, the quality of the meal, surpasses most and rivals the best, yet in a very non-pretentious setting. It was perfect and I can't wait to go back.

HavuH2j3kz-wyQa8OIgezg.text: Am I missing something? What is so great about this place? They don't take reservations, the restaurant is poorly arranged and incredibly cramped (servers tripping over each other, tables mere inches apart, noise level is basically a roaring din --- it felt like eating at an Arbys at a Bus Station in Newark).   The food was nothing spectacular either - the burrata  appetizer was very basic, and you can get better at Fry's Marketplace up the road. The rotating special Tortelli was good, but the four cheese Gnocchi was incredibly gummy and I honestly hate to say this, but, the sauce totally smelled like my dog's food. Wildly unappealing.  I will say our server was genuine and nice, though he forgot to ask me for a refill of wine. The credit card app didn't work and the server had to go stand by the window to get a signal - it's 2017, how is that a thing?   This place gets an insane amount of positive buzz on Facebook and on Nextdoor. I think people are just excited for a restaurant in the area that's not McDonalds.
